loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe Deggo est crée en début  de l’année 2010. Il  compte 09 femmes qui  habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Diaraï D. (debout à l’extrême droit de la photo) est responsable du  groupe. Elle est âgée de  46 ans et mère de quatre enfants.
 
Elle est vendeuse de tissus et divers produits vestimentaires. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiquée pendant environs 8 ans.

Son nouveau  crédit lui permettra d’acheter des lots de tissus pour les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de la ville de Kolda.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de santé et de nourriture des enfants.
texts.en:
The Deggo group was created in early 2010. It is composed of 9 women who all live in the same neighborhood. Their main activity is small trade.

Mrs Diaraï D. (standing on the far right of the picture) is the group's representative. She is 46 and a mother of 4.

She sells fabrics and various clothing items. She has been working in this field for about 8 years, which gives her a solid experience.

Thanks to this new loan, she will be able to buy lots of fabrics she will sell in the weekly markets in the city of Kolda.

With the profits from this business, she will help her husband take care of food and medical expenses for their children.

loans.use: to buy fabrics she will sell in the weekly markets in the city of Kolda

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila es una madre de familia de  44 años de edad,  vive con su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande – Piura. Lucila vive en la parte rural de este distrito, donde se dedican principalmente a la agricultura y ganadería.

Lucila se dedica a la venta de miel de abeja y  algarrobina (especie de miel extraída del algarrobo) a la cual le da un valor agregado al envasarlos. Se dedica a esto desde hace 5 años. Complementariamente Lucila vende joyas a los pobladores de su zona, que se sienten satisfechos con sus productos.
 
Con estas actividades Lucila contribuye a los aportes de su esposo, quien es agricultor y cuenta con parcela propia donde tiene mango en producción.

Lucila solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar mercadería (miel, algarrobina y envases) para su negocio, pues sus pedidos aumentan periódicamente y así aumentarán sus ventas.

Lucila  ha trabajado anteriormente con Edpyme Alternativa y sus créditos los pagó puntual y responsablemente. Esta es una familia que goza de buenas referencias.
texts.en:
Lucila is a 44 year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in Tambogrande district - Piura.  Lucila lives in the rural part of this district where people mainly farm and raise livestock.

Lucila sells bees' honey and 'algarrobina' (a type of syrup extracted from the black carob tree).  She provides her products with added value by putting them in containers.  She has been in this business for five years.  In addition, Lucila also sells jewelry to people in her area who feel happy with her products.

Through these business activities, Lucila contributes financially to her household alongside her husband who is a farmer and owns his own plot of land where he grows mangos.

Lucila is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy merchandise (honey, algarrobina and containers) for her business as her orders increase periodically and, therefore, so do her sales.

Lucila has worked with Edpyme Alternativa previously and she repaid her loans punctually and responsibly.  Hers is a family with good references.

loans.use: to buy honey, algarrobina (a type of syrup from the black carob tree) and containers

loans.name: Andrea Mercedes

texts.es:
Andrea de 50 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, tiene servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Razuri a unos 15 minutos de la provincia de Ascope y a una hora aproximadamnete del  departamneto de la Libertad (Trujillo).  Esta zona  se caracteriza por tener una mucha actividad agricola, ganadera, artesanía y turismo .

Andrea ha acondicionado en una parte de su sala de su casa un espacio para poner su negocio donde  vende toda clase de productos para uso personal (ropa para todas las edades y calzado ) por catálogo, tiene su propia clientela que le hace pedidos.  La venta de sus productos incermenta sus  ingresos lo que le permite solventar sus gastos y necesidades.

A solicitado Andrea a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles para surtir su negocio con mercadería novedosa tanto en ropa como en otros productos, ya que en esta zona son pocas las personas  que se dedican a este rubro, lo que le permite tener exito en su negocio y cada vez cresca más. Con los ingresos de la venta de todos sus productos cubriría las cuotas del crédito brindado y mejoraría su calidad de vida.

Andrea es una persona muy conocida por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y siempre con ganas de que su familia propere.
texts.en:
Andrea is 50 years old and lives with her husband and children in her own home.  Her home has piped water and electricity, and is located in Razuri district, 15 minutes from Ascope province and approximately one hour from La Libertad (Trujillo) department.  This area is noted for the fact that a lot of people work in farming, livestock raising, handicrafts and tourism.

Andrea has adapted a space in her living room for her business where she sells all kinds of personal use products (clothes for all ages and footwear) through catalogs.  She has existing customers who place orders with her.  The sale of her products makes her income which allows her to cover her expenses and needs.

Andrea has requested a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to stock her business with the latest merchandise (both clothes and other products).  There are not many people in her area who are in this line of business and this enables her to be successful and to keep growing her business.  With the profits that she makes from selling her products, she will repay her loan and improve her quality of life.

Andrea is very well known for being a hard-working, responsible woman who is always wanting her family to do well.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Dominga Clementina

texts.es:
Dominga es comerciante de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos, iniciando con el objetivo de poder apoyar a su familia.
Atreves de los años ha mejorado su vivienda, logro apoyar a sus hijos al crecer sanos, educados, hoy en día casados. Su esposo trabaja en la venta de granos básicos creciendo cada día en ventas.
Con el crédito anterior logro avanzar bastante, ahora el crédito será para embaldosar y cambiar parte del techo, comprando laminas de zinc, arena, cemento.
Contenta ya que cada día logra el objetico de una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Dominga has a business selling clothing, shoes and cosmetics.  She started the business because she wanted to be able to support her family.

Through the years she has made improvements to her home, and she managed to support her children so that they could grow up healthy and have an education.  Today her children are married.  Her husband works selling staple grains, and his sales are growing each day.

With the previous loan, she managed to make quite a bit of progress. Now this loan will be used to replace part of her roof and tile it.  She will use the loan to buy corrugated metal roofing material, sand and cement.  

She is pleased because every day she gets closer to her goal of having a decent home.

loans.use: to make improvments in her home: to replace part of the roof and to tile the roof

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter K. M. is 49 years old. He is married and has three children.  

To earn a living, he sells old newspapers. He has been in the business for 20 years and has employed two people. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, his business has grown tremendously. He sees himself having a big business in five years. He has requested 80,000 KES to buy more newspapers and renovate his house.

loans.use: To  buy more newspapers and renovate his house.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con sus 2 hijos  en una casa que le dejo su ex esposo antes de separarse de ella.  Esta vivienda cuenta con luz eléctrica pero no con los servicios de agua y desagüe y  esta ubicada en el distrito Las Lomas en Piura.

Mercedes recibe mensualmente una pensión para sus hijos. Sin embargo, esto no le basta para todos los gastos y es por ello que Mercedes tiene muchos deseos de superación. Sobretodo por sus hijos. Hace 6 años Mercedes puso, con mucho esfuerzo, una bodega en su propio domicilio,  Mercedes vende productos de primera necesidad así como abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, aceite). Ella atiende todos los días y cuenta con clientela ya conocida y establecida.

Mercedes solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1200 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de productos para su negocio (sobretodo abarrotes). Esto le permitirá a Mercedes seguir vendiendo y por lo tanto ganando para darle satisfacciones a sus menores hijos.

Mercedes desea mucho incrementar sus inventarios y por ende sus ventas para seguir creciendo con su negocio. Estaría muy agradecida con el crédito.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 31 years old.  She is a single mother who lives with her two children in a house that her ex-husband left her before they separated.  Her home has electricity but does not have piped water or sewerage services.  It is located in Las Lomas district, in Piura.

Mercedes receives a monthly maintenance payment for her children.  However, this is not enough to cover all of their expenses and, for this reason, Mercedes has a great desire to do better, for her children's sake.  Six years ago, with a lot of effort, Mercedes set up a grocery store in her own home.  She sells essential household products such as groceries (rice, sugar and oil).  She serves in her store every day and has an established customer base.

Mercedes is requesting a loan for 1,200 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to buy products for her business (mainly groceries).  This will allow her to continue selling and earning money to meet her childrens' needs.

Mercedes would really like to increase her stock and thereby her sales so that she can continue growing in her business.  She is very grateful for this loan.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her business

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana es una cliente de 33 años de edad  es soltera y vive en casa familiar en la parte rural del distrito de Túcume- Lambayeque. Ella es conocida en su barrio por ser una mujer noble y de buenos modales

Adriana se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, cuenta con ganado ovino y esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años en su domicilio, conoce a la perfección el rubro. Además, cuenta con una clientela ya establecida en la zona.

Adriana solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar aves de corral, alimento balanceado y para mejorar el corral de sus ovejas. Adriana se siente muy confiada en que su negocio mejorará y esto le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Adriana  es un cliente antiguo  para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Adriana is a 33-year-old client.  She’s single and lives in the family home in a rural part of Túcume District, Lambayeque.  She is known in her neighborhood for being a noble, well mannered woman.

Adriana raises animals to sell.  She has sheep and has been in this line of work for two years at home; she knows the occupation to perfection.  She also has a well established customer base in the zone.

Adriana is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy barnyard fowl, nutritionally balanced feed and to make some improvements to the sheep corral.  Adriana feels very confident that her business will improve making possible a better quality of life for her.  Adriana is a longstanding Edpyme Alternativa client.

loans.use: to buy barnyard fowl, animal feed and to make some improvements to the corrals.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina tiene 39 años  y es madre de 3 hijos con los cuales vive junto con su esposo, en la zona rural del distrito de Reque – Chiclayo. La actividad principal de esta zona es la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores (pavos, patos, cuyes, chanchos, etc.).

Martina tiene una familia muy unida, sus hijos la ayudan con su negocio de crianza y venta de cerdos. Ella tiene aproximadamente 15 años dedicándose a esto y conoce muy bien las preferencias de su clientela, una clientela ya establecida. Martina realiza esta actividad en la parte exterior de su casa donde tiene sus corrales para cerdos.

Martina solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1700 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de alimentos balanceados para sus animales y en el  mejoramiento del corral de estos. Martina tiene pensado mejorar la calidad de su cría para mayor productividad comercial. Actualmente se está asesorando cpn expertos en este rubro.

Martina quiere sacar adelante a su familia es una mujer trabajadora que estaría muy agradecida  con este crédito. Es una cliente recurrente de nuestra entidad.
texts.en:
Martina, 39, is the mother of three children; she lives with them and her husband in the rural part of Reque District, Chiclayo.  The main activity in this area is farming and raising small farm animals (ducks, turkeys, guinea pigs, pigs, etc.)

Martina has a very united family; her children help her with her business raising and selling pigs.  She has about 15 years in this line of work and is very knowledgeable about her customers’ preferences, an already well established clientele.  Martina carries out this activity in her yard where her pig corrals are located.

Martina is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1700 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her animals and to make some improvements on their corral.  Martina intends to improve the quality of her herd for better commercial productivity.  She is currently getting advice from experts in the field.

Martina wants to move her family forward; she is a hard working woman who is grateful for the loan.  She is a recurrent client of our firm.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed and to make some corral improvements.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es:
Luis de oficio transportista, con más de cinco años, teniendo su negocio propio. Anteriormente laboraba de ingeniero naval. 
Con su liquidación y financiamiento en Afodenic, ha logrado aumentar en productos básicos comprando más, y logrando mejores ventas. En los departamentos. También tiene un ingreso fijo al trabajar un camión para carga  en una empresa.
Tiene dos hijos pequeños aun el cual espera poder dar educación para un porvenir mejor.
Con esta nueva solicitud comprara cincuenta quintales de maíz, el cual venderá en la costa atlántica, teniendo mejores ventas y mejor precio sus productos.
texts.en:
Luis works in transportation and has had his own business for more than 5 years. Before he worked as a naval engineer. With his settlement and a loan from Afodenic he has been able to increase the number of basic products that he buys, and improve his sales in the departments. He also has fixed income from a cargo truck.  

He has two small children who he hopes he will be able to provide an education for a better future. 

With this new request he will buy 50 hundred-weights of corn, which he will sell on the Atlantic coast, getting better sales and better prices for his products.

loans.use: to buy 50 hundred-weights of corn to get better sales in the northern part of the country

loans.name: Aleyda Maryinee

texts.es:
Aleyda es comerciante, casada, madre de tres hijos. Hace diez años inicio sus ventas de ropa usada, cosméticos con poco capital de ahorro. Luego nace la iniciativa de invertir más, lo que recurre al financiamiento para poder comprar más mercaderías y tener mejores resultado de ventas, siendo la ropa de buena calidad, bonita, y barata. Habiéndole puertas en su comercio.
La inversión que hará es la compra de pacas mixtas, para seguir elevando ventas, tiene ropa en existencia, pero es  un negocio que se vende mucho la ropa de segunda. Es por eso con este crédito hará rotar la mercadería, así como la compra de cosméticos, y sandalias para ofertar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Aleyda works as a merchant and is married, with children.  Ten years ago, using the few savings she had, she began her business of selling second-hand clothing and cosmetics.  Since then she has wanted to invest more capital and is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise.  This will allow her to increase sales with quality, fashionable and inexpensive clothing, helping expand her business.

She plans to use the loan to buy mixed packs of clothing.  She currently has some items in stock but there is a large demand for used clothing.  With this loan she will be able to sell her goods and buy cosmetics and sandals to offer her customers.

loans.use: To buy mixed packs, cosmetics and sandals for retail sales.

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor es una madre soltera de 33 años de edad vive en casa de sus padres en el distrito de Nueva Arica – Chiclayo. Flor es una persona alegre muy conocida y querida en su zona. Tiene muy buenas referencias personales.

Flor se dedica al negocio de cría y venta de animales menores ( cuyes, gallinas, pavos ,cerdos) en su distrito. Ella es una madre trabajadora que realiza estas actividades todos los días por el bienestar de su pequeño hijo.

Flor solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales. Ella  quiere que sus animales sean de mejor calidad para poder comercializarlos a mejores precios y con la ganancia obtenida de eso comprarse más animales y así expandir su negocio.

Flor es una mujer con muchos deseos de superación y cuenta con experiencia crediticia en nuestra entidad.
texts.en:
Flor is a 33 year-old single mother who lives in her parent's home in the Nueva Arica district of Chiclayo.  Flor is a very cheerful person who is well-known and loved in her neighborhood.  She has very good personal references.

Flor has a business raising and selling small animals (guinea pigs, hens, turkeys and pigs) in her district.  She is a hardworking mother who works every day to provide for her small child.

Flor is requesting a loan of 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which she will use to purchase nutritionally balanced feed for her animals.  She wants her animals to be of the best quality so that she can sell them at the best prices.  With her earnings from this activity she wants to buy more animals and in this way expand her business.

Flor is a woman who has a strong desire to succeed, and she also has credit experience with our institution.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed

loans.name: Xiomara Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Xiomara del Socorro Mendoza, tiene la edad de 59 años, habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, es madre soltera, actualmente tiene una hija a su cargo, los planes hacia su familia es poder cambiar las paredes de tabla que están bastante dañadas por bloques, ya que en tiempos de lluvia  se pasa y es muy incomodo  para ellas estar en medio de agua , doña Xiomara desde hace varios años labora de conserje y la mayor afectación que se le presenta es no poder contar con el apoyo económico para realizar las compra de materiales de construcción de una sola vez , ella se siente contenta por el apoyo y la con fianza que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva para que ella poco a poco realiza su gran sueño de tener su vivienda completamente de bloque y zinc.
texts.en:
Mrs. Xiomara del Socorro Medoza, age 59, lives in the town of Ticuantepe.  She is a single mother and has a daughter in her care.  The plans for her family include changing the damaged wooden boards on the walls for concrete blocks.  During the rainy season water gets in and causes discomfort in the living environment.  

Doña Xiomara has worked as a concierge for several years.  Her biggest challenge is not having enough economic support to buy construction materials at all one time.  She is happy about the support and confidence Afodenic is showing her through Kiva so that, little by little, she can achieve her dream of having a house made completely out of cement blocks and zinc.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Virgen De La Puerta Group

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Grupo “Virgen D. L. Puerta”, tiene su negocio D. internet, también se dedica a L. compra y venta D. granos al por mayor y menor, Vilma vive con su esposo, sus hijos ya son mayores D. edad quienes ya son independientes, el préstamo lo invertirá para L. compra D. una computadora con L. cual ampliara los servicios D. internet que brinda.

(*) L. Foto pequeña corresponD. a L. Sra. Ruth Nancy
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the "Virgen D. L. Puerta" Group.  She has an Internet services business and also buys and sells wholesale grains.  Vilma lives with her husband.  Her adult children are independent.  The loan will be used to buy a computer in order to expand her Internet services.

(*) The small photograph is of Mrs. Ruth Nancy

loans.use: To buy a computer for Internet services.

loans.name: Pablo Enrique

texts.es: El señor Pablo Enrique, tiene la edad de 38 años , habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su compañera de vida la cual trabaja  para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen dos hijos a su cargo los cuales cursan su primaria , los planes hacia un futuro es poder realizar cambios dentro de la vivienda para darles un mejo bienestar a su familia , don Pablo desde hace veinte años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor afectación que  se le presenta es no poder contar con un recurso económica para estar trabajado la tierra , el quiere el financiamiento para establecer una manzana de Chiltomas y comprar los insumos necesarios para su mantención del cultivo .
texts.en:
Mr. Pablo Enrique, age 38, lives in the town of Ticuantepe.  He has a live-in partner who works as a housekeeper to help cover household expenses.  They have two children who are in primary school.  The plans they have for the future include home improvement to provide a better lifestyle for the family.

Don Pablo has worked in agriculture for 20 years.  The biggest challenge he has is coming up with enough economic resources to farm the land.  He is requesting a loan to begin growing bell peppers, for which he needs to buy crop maintenance supplies.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Maria Auxiliadora, tiene la edad de 32 años , habitan en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja para compartir los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen tres hijos los cuales estudian su primaria , los planes hacia un futuro es poder terminar de construir la vivienda  , ya que con los dos créditos anterior logro  repellar la parte delantera de la casa y embaldosar , ahora quiere que se le apoye para poder cerrar un cuarto ya que ella es comerciante de frutas y verduras y no cuenta con grandes ganancias para  comprar de una sola solo vez materiales de construcción como bloques, arena , cemento , zinc , etc. .Agradece la confianza brindada por Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva ya que apoyan a los pobres para que sus condiciones de vida cambien y sea para desarrollo del mismo país.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Auxiliadora, age 32, lives in the town of Ticuantepe, with her husband who shares the household expenses.  They have three children in primary school.  Their plans for the future are to finish building their house, since the first two loans they received were used to add siding and tile to the front of the house.  Now they are requesting support to finish a room.

She is a fruit and vegetable vendor and does not have enough income to buy all the construction materials, such as blocks, sand, cement, zinc, etc., at one time.  She is grateful for the confidence shown in her by Afodenic through the Kiva fund which helps people in poverty change their conditions, thus leading to development in the same country.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Roberto Jose

texts.es: El señor Roberto Jose , tiene la edad de 26 años , habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual labora como comerciante de ropa y zapato para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene un hijo , los planes futuros hacia su vivienda es poder construirla en su totalidad de piedra ya que la que habita actualmente es de piedra , madera y plástico , don Roberto desde hace seis años labora  en una empresa privada, la mayor afectación que se le presenta es no poder contar con capital suficente para realizar la comprar piedras , cemento , arena , hierro y otros  .Agradece a Afodenic atrávez de Kiva los interés bajos , la confianza y sobre todo el apoyo que le dan a gente de escasos recursos que por medio de sus posibilidades quieren mejor su condición  de vida .
texts.en:
Señor Roberto José is 26 years old.  He lives in the town of Ticuantepe with his wife who sells clothing and footwear for a living to help with the household expenses.  They have one child.  Their future plans are to be able to build a house made completely of stone since the house they are currently living in is made of stone, wood and plastic.  Don Roberto has been working as a laborer for a private company for the last six years.  He doesn't earn enough however, to purchase stones, cement, sand, iron, and other materials.  

He is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva for the low interest rates, their trust and above all the support they provide to people of limited resources who want to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Jacqueline Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Jacqueline, tiene la edad de 22 años, habita el barrio San Ignacio, junto a su esposo el cual labora como chofer para apoyarla con los gastos del hogar  , ellos tiene dos hijos a su cargo , los sueños de doña Jacqueline es poder apoyar siempre en sus estudios a sus hijos para que no pasen por las grandes dificultades económicas como ellas las ha pasado , ella tiene   dos años laborando como comerciante de queso , verduras y frutas , la mayor afectación que se le presenta son las alza en los productos  y las ventas están malas por la situación económica que enfrenta al país ; con el primer crédito logro incrementar su negocio ya que antes solo se dedicaba a la venta de queso y ahora tiene un puesto de frutas y verduras .
texts.en: Jacqueline is 22 years old. She lives in the neighborhood of San Ignacio in the municipality of Concepción with her husband, who works as a chauffeur to help her with household expenses. They have two children. Jacqueline's dream is to be able to always support her children's education so they do not go through the great financial difficulties that she has experienced. She has been working for two years selling cheese, fruit, and vegetables. The greatest problem she faces are the increase in products and sales are bad due to the economic situation the country faces. With her first loan she succeeded in increasing her business, because before she only sold cheese, and now she has a fruit and vegetable stand.

loans.use: buy fruits, vegetables, and dairy products.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: El señor Roberto Antonio Gómez L. , tiene la edad de 29 años , habita en el comunidad loma Negras , en el municipio de la Concepción , junto a su esposa la cual le apoya con las actividades del hogar y se encarga de vender el producto cuanto este ya está en su estado de corte , don Roberto desde hace diez años trabaja al campo , durante este tiempo la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son los problemas de plagas y enfermedades que afectan al cultivo de mandarina , el crédito lo quiere para comprar exfoliantes e insumos necesarios para realizar aplicación  en todas las plantas y poder salvar la producción ya que no cuenta con un capital suficiente para realizar la comprar de fertilizantes .
texts.en: Roberto Antonio Gómez L. is 29 years old.  He lives in the Loma Negras community in the town of La Concepción with his wife, who supports him by taking care of the house and selling the produce once it is harvested. Don Roberto has been working in the fields for ten years.  During this time, his greatest difficulty has been the problem of infestations and illnesses that affect the cultivation of tangerines.  He wants the loan to buy fertilizer sprays and the supplies necessary to apply them to all the plants in order to be able to save the harvest, since he doesn't have sufficient capital to buy fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction supplies.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 56-year-old married woman living in the Philippines. Zenaida has four children and they are mostly adult-aged. She has been in her business for three years. Zenaida plans to use her loan to buy additional antibiotics, vitamins, herbs and some groceries.

Zenaida is looking forward to the betterment of her buy and sell of medicines and general store businesses. She hopes that she can maintain the businesses, increase the profit she generates from her businesses and to save money for security purposes when she get weak.

loans.use: to purchase additional medicine such as antibiotics, herbs, and vitamins and some groceries

loans.name: Ofelia's Group

texts.en: Ofelia is 55 years of age with three children and married to a company driver. Her group has six members. The group works hard to improve their way of living. Ofelia is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional feed for her hogs. She earns PHP 4,000 every three months in her hog-raising business. The members hope that Kiva lenders will continue to give them financial assistance for the development of their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her hogs

loans.name: Ruelma Cayaba's Group

texts.en:
Ruelma is a married woman with three children. She is already 31 years old and has a food selling business that, according to her, is a newly opened business she chose to manage.

She sells different kinds of vegetables, fruits, meat and fish. She is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy various products such as tomatoes, bananas, cabbage, potatoes, etc. 

In the future, Ruelma is hoping to grow her business for the betterment of their daily living. She also wants her group, composed of nine members, to have successful businesses in the long run through ASKI and KIVA's help.

loans.use: to buy various products such as tomatoes, bananas, cabbage, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Luzviminda Catembung's Group

texts.en:
Luzviminda dreams of becoming a successful livestock farmer. She works hard to attain this to improve her family's living standard. She is already 41 years old and married with three school-aged children. Her husband is a farmer who tills a rice and corn field. Farming has been their main source of income. 

She raises pigs for fattening and sale, which is her family's alternative source of income to support the studies of her children. It is very helpful when there are emergencies. She is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 as additional capital to buy feed and medicines for her piglets. Some of the loan will also be used to buy fertilizers for their farm. After two years of raising pigs, Luz had proven that this business is very helpful for her family needs.

loans.use: To buy feed and medicines for her piglets and to buy fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Annabelle Mariano's Group

texts.en: Annabelle is the leader of a seven-member group loan. Annabelle is married and 44 years old. She has a furniture making business where she sells tables, chairs, and cabinets in their village. She has operated this business for almost 15 years. Annabelle is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase burnishes (polishes) to beautify the products. She usually earns about PHP 5,000 each month in this business. She desires to have a successful furniture making business someday.

loans.use: To buy burnishes for furniture making

loans.name: Jeralyn Ignacio's Group

texts.en:
Jeralyn is married and 44 years old with two grown children. She is the leader of a 13-member group loan.  She has a retail shop where she offers daily-use products such as creamer, coffee, sugar, bath soap, shampoo, toothpaste, food snacks like soft drinks and crackers and a lot more. Jeralyn has had this business for six years. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 16,000 to purchase coffee, spices, sugar, etc. to generate additional income. 

In the future, Jeralyn hopes to become successful in making her business grow and giving her family a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase coffee, spices, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a hardworking entrepreneur living in the Philippines. She is 35 years old and married. Jennifer has three children. Jennifer's spouse works as a buyer and seller of scrap materials in different places.

Jennifer has been buying and selling scrap materials and each month she earns Php 5,000. She is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000. She plans to use this loan to purchase additional scrap materials. Jennifer has been a client of ASKI for four years. In the future, Jennifer would like to improve her business through her hard work and the assistance of KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional scrap materials

loans.name: Kishegyere Kwetungura Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
Francis M. is the leader of Kishegyere Kwetungura group A in Kihihi. He is 39 years old and married with three children all school-going. 

He is an agriculturalist involved in tea farming. He has been selling tea leaves to Kayonza Tea Factory in Kishegyere for over 20 years. Previously, Francis was involved in the sale of coffee and goats, and the tea growing and selling is an additional business. 

He makes 550,000 KES as profits monthly and he hopes that will grow over time. 

His plan is to have more acres of tea and have his children educated. 

He says that ever since he started taking loans, his sales have increased. At the moment, he needs a loan to be able to buy manure and pay for labor for his tea farms.

loans.use: To buy manure and pay for labor for his tea farms.

loans.name: Kishegyere Kwetungura Group B, Kihihi

texts.en:
Ephraim B. is the leader of Kishegyere Kwetungura group B in Kihihi. He is 37 years old and married with four children, all school-going. 

He is an agriculturalist involved in tea farming. He has been selling tea leaves to the Kayonza Tea factory in Kishegyere for over 10 years. 

Previously, Ephraim was involved in the sale of coffee and cows, and the tea growing and selling is an additional business. 

He makes 650,000 KES as profits monthly and he hopes that will grow over time. His plan is to have more acres of tea and have his children educated. 

He says that ever since he started taking loans, his sales have increased and at the moment, he needs a loan to be able to buy manure and pay for labor for his tea farms.

loans.use: To buy manure and pay for labor for his tea farms.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a young woman from Rafah in the Gaza Strip. Iman is the mother of Siba, one year old, Ameen, four years old, and Majd, three years old. Iman is married to a Palestinian National Authority employee.

As the family's income is meager and doesn't cover their expenses due to the relatively high cost of living in Palestine. Iman and her husband managed to have a grocery store with the help of relatives to increase their income.

Iman took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a large variety of goods to increase sales and thus income. Iman's husband is photographed here as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of inventory.

loans.name: Israa

texts.en:
Israa is a 39-year-old working mother, married to Mohammad, a 46-year-old driver. They decided to open a small business so they rented a storeroom to start a poultry breeding business.

Israa has applied for more than one loan over the last three years to be able to start up her business and she has succeeded in it. She started by buying a few chicken to get eggs to sell. But since they have some space around their house, Israa thought of building their own poultry breeding place to get rid of the monthly rentA. fees and to expand her business to increase their income. That’s why she applied for this loan.

Since Israa is a conservative woman, her husband Mohammad agreed to have a picture taken of him with her business.

loans.use: To build their own chicken-raising house.

loans.name: Nyamabare_ Tweyimukye Group, Bushenyi

texts.en:
Richard M. is the leader of Nyamabare Tweyimukye group in Bushenyi. He is 46 years old and married with six children. Four of them are in school. 

Richard is a teacher by profession offering teaching services to Katerera town council schools. He is also involved in agriculture and sells the produce. One of his future plans is to start up a poultry business. 

He is able to generate 310,000 KES monthly and he needs a loan to be able to pay school fees for his children this term. He is a very hard-working man and hopes for the best for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children this term.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase home electronic accessories

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is a 60-year-old housewife married to Omar. They have four married children. She worked in the retail business for 15 years and then started a small home business three years ago, selling household supplies such as pans, cups, glasses, trays, etc. During these three years, she was able to open her own store to sell household supplies and add more items and brands to the products she sells. Then she taught her son the business so he can continue running their successful business. She gave the store to her son so he can have an income source to support his family, and she has applied for a loan to buy new products and items to get more variety in the store.

Dalal is a conservative person so she recommended that her son appear in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more household products to sell

loans.name: Katerera Farmers Group, Bushenyi

texts.en:
Vasta M. is the leader of Katerera farmers group in Bushenyi. He is 45 years old and married with seven children. Five of them are still in school. 

Vasta deals in the trading of produce like coffee, cotton, beans and maize from Nyamirima. He has done this work for over 12 years and he is able to generate 550,000 UGX monthly. 

He is very hard working and knowledgeable and he is happy that he was trained by a friend and his parents. 

He is a credit-worthy person and his dream is to educate his children and increase his loan amount to ensure sustainable growth. He needs a loan to be able to increase stock, especially coffee and cotton.

loans.use: To increase stock, especially coffee and cotton.

loans.name: Joelyn

texts.en:
Joelyn is married and 26 years old. She has a retail shop where she sells different kinds of goods such as canned goods, sugar, seasonings, soft drinks, biscuits, detergent, shampoo, bath soap and bar soap. Joelyn has had this business for two years. 

Joelyn is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy groceries such as shampoo, bar soap, detergent, ingredients, milk, sugar, junk foods, biscuits, soft drinks and other kinds of products needed daily. Each month, Joelyn earns about PHP 9,000 doing this type of work. She hopes that she can expand her general store and improve it through the help of KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk, soft drinks, biscuits, shampoo, detergent, bar soap and junk foods

loans.name: Salvador

texts.en: Salvador is 43 years of age and married with two school-aged children. He earns about PHP 10,000 for each crop as a farmer working in the Philippines. He grows corn and has been doing it for over 20 years. Salvador is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizers and corn seeds for his farm. He dreams of having high yields to earn profits to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Javier Armando

texts.es:
El Señor Javier S. de 26 años, esta en concubinato con la Sra. Ramona González de 23 años de edad, ellos tienen una hija. 
Don Javier se dedica a la venta de mercaderias en forma ambulante hace más de 3 años, aproximadamente desde el año 2008; comenzó con el capital que obtuvo ahorrando estando como empleado de una carpintería, empezó vendiendo ropas a la gente de su comunidad. Poco a poco fue creciendo su venta y en la actualidad ya tiene su clientela formada. 
Javier solicita este crédito para comprar más mercaderías (pantalones vaqueros, remeras, camisas, camperas,etc.) y seguir adelante con su trabajo para mantener a su concubina, su hija y de la misma manera satisfacer a sus fieles clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Javier Salvero, 26, lives unmarried with Ramona González.  They have a daughter.

Javier is a street vendor of general merchandise; he’s been in business for over three years since about 2008.  He started out with capital he’d saved while employed at a carpenter shop.  He started selling among people in his community and gradually his sales increased and now he has a well established clientele.

Javier is asking for this loan to buy more merchandise (jeans, t-shirts, shirts, jackets, etc.) to continue working to support his spouse and daughter as well as meeting the needs of his faithful customers.

loans.use: to buy jeans, t-shirts, shirts and jackets.

loans.name: Sindulfo

texts.es:
El señor Sindulfo V. tiene 44 años de edad, está casado con  la señora Maria Gloria Salinas quien tiene 36 años de edad, ambos de la ciudad de Caacupe, distante a unos 60 kilómetros de la ciudad capital (Asunción). Tiene 2 hijos ambos menores de edad. 
El Señor Sindulfo vive en el barrio San Antonio y en su domicilio cuenta con una Mercería y también un taller de gomería  hace 3 años. 
Allí provee los mejores servicios a sus clientes, es muy conocido por ello en la zona.
Por más que el señor Sindulfo y su esposa trabajen mucho tienen algunas necesidades. Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la gomería, con el fin de satisfacer a sus clientes, mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Sindulfo V., 44, is married to Mrs. María Gloria Salinas, 36.  They are both from the city of Caacupe about 60 kilometers from the capital city, Asunción.  He has two minor children.

Sindulfo lives in the San Antonio neighborhood and has had a hardware store and tire repair shop in his house for the last three years. He provides customer service there and is very well known because of this in his area.

Regardless of how hard Sindulfo and his wife work they still have unmet needs.  He’s asking for the loan to buy tire repair supplies in order to meet customer demand and improve income and his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tire repair supplies.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Ramona tiene 33 años, está acompañada con Alberto Martinez y tienen 3 hijos, todos ellos se encuentran en edad escolar.
Se dedica a la panaderia desde hace tres años aproximadamente, fabrica sus panificados y realiza sus ventas en un carro estirado por un caballo por las zonas conocidas como Cañadas e Itayvu (ciudad de Piribebuy y Caacupé respectivamente). 
Doña Ramona, como es conocida en la comunidad, cuenta con clientela formada a quienes en forma diaria los visita a entregarles su producto recien salido del horno.
Solicita el crédito especialmente para la compra de harina, levadura y los elementos necesarios para continuar con su negocio de panadería, mediante esto ella podrá ir aumentando sus ingresos y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, que cada vez van aumentando. Por ello agradece a Fundacion Paraguaya y Kiva por tan ponderado apoyo y confianza.
texts.en:
Ramona, 33, is in a relationship with Alberto Martínez; they have three school age children.

She’s been a Baker for the last three years approximately.  She manufactures her baked goods and sells them from a horse-drawn cart throughout the areas of Cañadas and Itayvu (cities of Piribebuy and Caacupé, respectively). Doña Ramona, as she’s known in the community, has a well established clientele that she visits daily to deliver products fresh out of the oven.

She is asking for this loan specifically to buy flour, yeast and other necessary elements to continue with her bakery.  Through it she will be able to increase her income and meet customer demand that increases each time.  Because of this she thanks Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for such considerable support and trust.

loans.use: to buy baking supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de Santo Domingo surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona, tiene 16 integrantes y se denomina "Mujeres Unidas", todas sus integrantes se caracterizan por su espíritu emprendedor y el esfuerzo constante que realizan por salir adelante en todas sus actividades diarias.
Una de las integrantes del grupo, por ejemplo, es la Señora Noelia E., tiene un hijo, es casada y su marido se desempeña como empleado público. Si bien él cuenta con un salario fijo mensual,  ella desea ayudarlo y se dedica a la venta de lencerías y ropas en el nuevo circuito comercial.  
En el caso de la señora Noelia, el crédito será importante porque lo utilizará para la compra de lencerías y ropas para volver a tener mayor opciones y variedad para sus clientes de la comunidad, así podrá puede mejorar sus ingresos y apoyar económicamente a la familia. 
Todas las señoras que integran el grupo también  realizan actividades productivas para ayudar a sus familias y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This Santo Domingo group arose as a result of promotional activities undertaken in the area.  It has 16 members and is called “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women).  All the members are noted for their enterprising spirit and the constant effort they put into getting ahead in all their daily activities.

One of the group members, for example, is Mrs. Noelia E..  She has a son, is married and her husband is employed as a Public Employee.  Although he earns a stable monthly salary, she wants to help him out and sells lingerie and clothes along the new commercial circuit.

In Noelia’s case the loan will be important because she’ll use it to buy lingerie and clothes in order to once again have more options and variety available for her customers in the community as well as earning better income to help her family economically.

All the ladies that compose the group also carry out productive activities to help their families and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lingerie and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de Asunción se encuentra integrados por 15 mujeres de la comunidad.
Ellas se dedican a variadas actividades: por ejemplo, la señora María A. posee un taller de costura, en donde confecciona todo tipo de ropas para sus clientes, es una modista muy conocida por la delicadeza y perfección en la realización de sus prendas, ella desea poder adquirir mayor cantidad de telas para poder hacer más ropas para ofrecer y dar una mejor variedad a sus clientes. 
La mayoría de estas "Mujeres Emprendedoras" son madres, algunas de las integrantes son madres solteras, para todas ellas es sumamente importante obtener el crédito, pues ello significaría un mejor ingreso y un apoyo para adquirir la materia prima para sus actividades.
Las "Mujeres Emprendedoras" se caracterizan por el esfuerzo, ya que deben llevar a sus hogares  el pan de cada dia y al mismo tiempo buscar la forma de mandar a la escuela a sus hijos para que puedan seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Emprendedoras" of Asunción group is made up of fifteen women from the community.  They are involved in a variety of activities.  María A., for example, has a sewing shop, where she makes all kinds of clothing for her clients.  She is a dressmaker well-known for the delicacy and perfectionism with which she makes her items.  She would like to have more fabrics so she can make additional products and offer her clients wider variety.

Most of the "Mujeres Emprendedoras" are mothers, some of them single.  Getting a loan is important to all of them because it would mean more income, and would help them get supplies for their businesses.  

The members are noted for their effort; they have to bring home the bacon every day while looking for ways to educate their children so they can be successful.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Mingueras Solidarias Group

texts.es:
Este comité comenzó gracias a la iniciativa la señora Mercedes L., del km 19 Monday de Ciudad del Este. Ella fue quien contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona. 
El comité se denomina Mingueras Solidarias y cuenta con diez integrantes. Es un grupo muy unido, solidario y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, se encuentran muy motivadas, solicitan el crédito para la compra de mercaderías y artículos de primera necesidad para sus actividades.
La sra. Mercedes se dedica la venta de ropas, ella es una mujer muy sacrificada, pues cada día trata de obtener buenas ganancias para poder mantener a sus hijos y así brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
Como no posee ropas de temporada para ofrecer a sus clientes, solicita este crédito a modo de poder adquirir abrigos y pantalones, y dar a las personas las ropas que necesitan para este periodo de frío. Ella espera poder contar con el apoyo de los inversionistas de Kiva.
texts.en:
This committee started out thanks to the initiative of Mrs. Mercedes L. from Ciudad del Este’s Km 19 Monday neighborhood.  She contacted her neighbors and friends to form a committee in the zone.

The committee is called Mingueras Solidarias and it has ten members.  It is a very unified, mutually supportive, responsible group.  The members have a great enterprising spirit and are quite motivated.  They are requesting the loan to buy merchandise and basic need articles for their activities.

Mercedes sells clothes.  She is a very longsuffering woman because she tries daily to earn good profits to support her children and provide them with a better quality of life.

Because she does not have any seasonal clothes to offer her customers, she’s asking for this loan in order to be able to acquire coats and pants to provide people with what is needed during this cold period.  She hopes to have support from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy basic need items like clothes, fruit, vegetables, foodstuffs and beverages, among others.

loans.name: Milagros Ii Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio San Miguel de Encarnación surgió mediante el contacto de la señora Graciela G. con la Fundación Paraguaya, y a partir de allí comenzaron a trabajar en conjunto. El grupo está integrado por 12 personas.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la señora Rosa R., ella es madre soltera tiene cuatro hijos y tiene un almacén, donde vende comestibles en su comunidad.
La señora Rosa solicita este crédito que lo utilizará para la compra de mercaderías como panificados, lácteos, cereales, frutas y verduras, pues si lo recibe podrá mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Todas las integrantes del grupo son mujeres muy sacrificadas que desean la prosperidad de sus familias, pues ellas han sufrido mucho a causa de la pobreza en la que se encuentran y la mayor meta que poseen por ello es la de superarla, para que sus hijos sean personas con mayores oportunidades de un mejor vivir.
texts.en:
This group from Barrio San Miguel de Encarnación came about through contact between Graciela G. and Fundación Paraguaya.  From that, they began to work together.  The group consists of 12 members.

One of the members of the group is Rosa R..  She is a single mother with four children, and she has a store in her community where she sells foodstuffs.

Rosa is asking for this loan to purchase merchandise such as bread products, milk products, cereals, fruits, and vegetables.  If she receives the loan, she will be able to increase her sales and improve her family's quality of life.

All of the members of the group are very self-sacrificing women who want prosperity for their families, since they have suffered a great deal from the poverty in which they find themselves. Therefore, their greatest goal is to rise above it, so that their children may be people with greater opportunities for a better life.

loans.use: to purchase bread products, milk products, cereals, fruits, and vegetables

loans.name: Mario César

texts.es:
El Sr. Mario es casado, tiene dos  hijos, y uno de ellos está en edad escolar.
Él se dedica a la venta de ropas y zapatos en forma ambulante, y por la noche trabaja como moto taxista, tiene su parada en el km. 4 de Ciudad del Este, el mismo negocio se halla cada vez más en ascenso, generándole un buen ingreso. 
Con la ayuda de su esposa  están  saliendo adelante, con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo.
Hoy día él es un microempresario exitoso con una clientela fiel y numerosa, debido a su amabilidad. Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos por lo que confía en que recibirá el apoyo de Kiva, pues solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas y zapatos que puedan ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes y así afianzar la fidelidad que estos le otorgan.
texts.en:
Mario is married and has two children; one is school aged.

He is clothes and shoes street vendor; at night he works as a taxi driver.  His taxi stand is at Ciudad del Este’s Kilometer 4.  This business is growing more each time generating good income for him.  With help from his wife they are getting ahead with much effort and sacrifice.

Today he is a successful micro entrepreneur with a numerous, loyal clientele thanks to his kindness.  He has shown himself to be a responsible, honest person with respect to his commitments so he trusts that Kiva will support him.  He is asking for the loan to buy clothes and shoes to offer a wider variety to his customers thereby solidifying the loyalty they have in him.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: María Ignacia

texts.es:
La Sra. María Ignacia, tiene  54 años de edad, estuvo casada con el Sr. Apolonio Benitez durante 34 años, del matrimonio nacieron 5 hijos: Mirian, Eusebio, Rolando, Ninfa y Liliana, viven en la Ciudad Nueva Londres, Coronel Oviedo.
María Ignacia es comerciante hace 18 años, tiene una despensa-carnicería en el centro mismo de la ciudad de Nueva Londres, una comunidad humilde de pobladores dedicados al ganado. Comenzó con un pequeño kiosko, donde vendía artículos de primera necesidad. Con el correr del tiempo fue creciendo, con mucho esfuerzo y con la compañía de su marido.
Se levanta muy temprano por la mañana para cuidar su pequeña granja, para alimentar a sus animales, ordeñar la vaca, para luego dedicarse a su negocio el cual es el sustento del hogar. 
Este negocio le ayudó a criar y a educar a todos sus hijos, algunos de los cuales ya son profesionales y de quienes está muy orgullosa porque supieron valorar el esfuerzo de sus padres. 
Para ella la familia es muy importante y le recuerda con mucha emoción a su marido a quien le perdió hace unos meses. Todo aquellos buenos recuerdos la impulsan y fortalecen para seguir luchando por sus hijos día a día. 
Se acercó a la Fundación Paraguaya con el objetivo de recibir apoyo crediticio que le ayude a salir adelante, para poder comprar artículos de primera necesidad como fideos, yerba mate, harina, azúcar, carnes, etc. para equipar mejor su almacén.
texts.en:
María Ignacia is 54 years old.  She was married to Apolonio Benitez for 34 years, and they had five children during their marriage: Mirian, Eusebio, Rolando, Ninfa, and Liliana.  They live in Nueva Londres near the city of Coronel Oviedo.

María Ignacia has been a businesswoman for 18 years.  She has a store selling groceries and meat in the center of the city of Nueva Londres, a humble community where people raise cattle.  She began with a small kiosk where she sold staple items.  With the passage of time it grew, with much effort and with the help of her husband.

She rises very early in the morning to take care of her small farm, feed her animals, and milk the cow, so that she then can devote herself to the business that sustains her home.

This business helped her raise and educate all of her children, some of whom are already professionals.  She is very proud of them because they knew how to value the effort of their parents.

For her, family is very important, and she remembers her husband, whom she lost a few months ago, with great emotion.  All of those good memories drive her and strengthen her to continue fighting for her children each day.

She approached Fundación Paraguaya with the objective of receiving a loan that will help her move forward and enable her to purchase staple items such as pasta, yerba mate, flour, sugar, meat, etc., to better supply her store.

loans.use: to purchase staple items such as sugar, yerba mate, flour, pasta, etc., for her store

loans.name: Las Hermanas Group

texts.es:
Este comité inició la Sra. Fátima M. domiciliada en el Barrio Santo Domingo de la Ciudad de Carapeguá. 
El comité denominado “Las Hermanas” es integrado por un grupo de señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras.
Algunas de las integrantes ya contaban con trabajo antes de formar parte del comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y se integraron para lograr mejorar sus emprendimientos, otras sin embargo comenzaron con su primera actividad luego de integrar este grupo.
El comité lo conforman mujeres muy sacrificadas que han luchado toda su vida para llevar adelante a sus familiares a pesar de los obstáculos que siempre existen. 
La Sra. Fátima se dedica hace varios años a la venta de comidas, ella se levanta muy temprano a preparar su comida para salir a vender. La venta lo realiza de forma ambulante y en el recorrido le ayudan sus hijos. 
La Sra Fatima agradece de manera especial a la Fundación por que mediante el apoyo brindado por la misma en periodos anteriores pudo acceder a más capital y así poder agrandar su negocio porque ahora cuenta con mas vendedores de comida.
Nuevamente solicita otro crédito para poder adquirir mayor cantidad de comestibles para la preparación de alimentos y su posterior venta.
texts.en:
Fátima M. began this group in Santo Domingo de la Ciudad de Carapeguá. The “Las Hermanas” group is comprised of several responsable and hard-working women who work to better their family's future.  Some of the members had been part of a group called "Mujeres Emprendedoras" and benefited from this association, while for others this is their first group activity.
Fátima has sold food items for many years, rising early to take her products door to door, and is assisted by her children.  She is grateful to the lending group for credit it has granted her which has allowed her to grow her business.  She seeks this loan to increase her inventory of food items, allowing her to expand sales.

loans.use: To buy materials and basic food items such as pasta, sugar, rice, soft drinks, flour, etc.

loans.name: Valeryi

texts.en:
Valeryi is married with a grown son. He lives in the small agricultural town of Gladkovka. Valeryi grows early spring vegetables: 6,000 tomatoes, 10,000 cabbage heads, 5,000 peppers, 5,000 eggplants and 5 tons of potatoes. Valeryi has been working in the sphere of agriculture for 20 years. He has invested about 150,000 Grivnyas in his business. 

Valeryi is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to invest in the purchase of seeds, plastic film and fertilizers, as well as to install a drip irrigation unit. He will do small repairs in his greenhouses.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, plastic film, fertilizers and install a drip irrigation unit

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is married with a teenage daughter. Maya is a market vendor from Belaya Tserkov. She sells children’s clothing items in a local market. She started this business 15 years ago. Her gross income amounts to 17,000 Grivnyas. Her net profit is over 5,500 Grivnyas.  

Maya is seeking a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase seasonal children’s clothing for further retail sale. She is hoping to re-stock her merchandise to offer a better selection of summer clothing items to her customers. Maya’s husband is actively helping his wife with business selling children’s clothing inventory in neighboring villages. Maya’s enterprising spirit is a key factor in the consistent development of her venture.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise wholesale

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with two grown daughters. She is a small market entrepreneur from Zaporozhye in thesouth-eastern part of Ukraine. She runs a clothing sales business at a local marketplace. Tatyana sells silk and chiffon scarves and wraps. She has been in this business for 13 years. Currently, Tatyana has 36,000 Grivnyas invested in inventory. Her net profit amounts to 7,000 – 8,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Tatyana is seeking a loan of 12,600 Grivnyas to purchase delicate light scarves and swimsuits for the upcoming summer season. She is hoping to diversify her merchandise by adding swimsuits to her inventory. Tatyana’s merchandise is unique at the marketplace and low competition only adds to the success of her growing business.

loans.use: to purchase summer scarves and swimsuits

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita G. is from the village of Pakatan Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 50 years old. Julita is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Julita owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business is selling food and drinks to passengers in the bus terminal. Julita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Julita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase ingredients for her food business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Julita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branch offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for the food she cooks for sale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia works hard to support two children. She is widowed and has a business making and selling lechon (roast pig) in the Philippines.  Cecilia has been in this business for 5 years, and earns additional income by raising livestock.

Cecilia has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase pigs and supplies for her business.  In the future, Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, wood, and charcoal for her lechon business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Elna works hard to support her family.

Elna has a dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store.  Elna is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy dried fish for her business.

Elna has been sustaining her business activities through 13 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is married with three children. She is 26 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Jennifer has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jennifer has requested a loan of PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jennifer has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is married with three children. She is 47 years old, and all her children are in school.  She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Anecita has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years. 

Anecita has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase utensils and ingredients for her business.  In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 37 years old and is married with three children, two of whom are in school.

Fe is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables and rice in the Philippines. Fe has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Fe has been farming vegetables and rice for five years now, and has borrowed from NWTF six previous times.

In the future, Fe would like to save enough money to buy more farm land and to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jesilly

texts.en:
As a married parent of 7 children, Jesilly works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport (habal-habal) business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from gasoline retailing. Jesilly is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy an additional motorcycle for her transport (habal-habal) business.

Jesilly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional motorcycle for her transport business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 59 years old.  She is a widow with five children.

Marina works hard to provide for her family. She has been running the sari-sari store for 8 years and also earns additional income from food vending.
She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for food production and more stock to sell in her store.

Marina has borrowed and paid 11 previous loans from NWTF before this one. She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en:
Geronima is 51 years old and has six children, one of which is in school. Geronima is married.

Geronima is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Geronima requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Geronima has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Geronima would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en:
Bernadith is 36 years old and married with 3 children.  With 2 children in school, Bernadith works very hard to provide for her family.

Bernadith runs a Sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.  Bernadith has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, bread, etc.

In the future, Bernadith would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Condrada

texts.en:
Condrada is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food sales business.

Condrada has been in this business for six years. Condrada earns more income from a computer shop.

Condrada has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food sales business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 56 years old and is married with six children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requests a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Erlinda aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sweetie Pie

texts.en:
Sweetie Pie Layugan is married and 47 years old. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of products needed by the people in her community. Sweetie Pie has had this business for eight years.

Sweetie Pie is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy additional products such as soft drinks, canned goods and condiments. Each month, Sweetie Pie earns 4,500 PHP doing this type of work.

In the future, Sweetie Pie hopes that her business will become a grocery store for her to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy additional products such as soft drinks, canned goods and condiments

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 40 years old and is married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Adela is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Adela has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Andrez

texts.en:
Andrea is a widow with two children in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Andrea is 49 years old.

Andrea has a food market business in the Philippines. Andrea requested a PHP 19,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her food market.

Andrea has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Andrea would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her food market.

loans.name: Floriano

texts.en: Floriano is 50 years of age and married with three adult-aged children. He is a farmer working in the Philippines. Floriano's wife is a housekeeper. Floriano is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy inputs needed for their field such as fertilizers and seeds of corn. He will also use the loan to pay for the laborers who will do the planting on his farm. In the future, Floriano hopes that his business will earn higher income from the yields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds and to pay the laborers

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine, a 39-year-old married mother of three children who are in school, has been raising pigs in the Philippines for 10 years now. Having received and repaid eight previous loans from NWTF, she is now requesting a PHP 15,000 loan  to buy piglets and feeds. In the future, Geraldine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en: Nestor is married with three school-aged children. He is a farmer working in the Philippines and has been doing this work for 20 years. Nestor is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase fertilizers and seeds of corn to be planted on their farm. Nestor hopes this loan will grow his operations. Currently, he earns PHP 60,000 for each crop in this field of work. Nestor desires to expand his farm site soon for additional income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie, a 38-year-old married mother of nine children, five of whom are in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. The operator of a personal products business in the Philippines for 14 years, Margie is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more personal products to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more personal products to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy G. is 52 years old and married. She has four children, with one in school. Nancy works very hard to provide for them.

Nancy runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. Nancy has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as diapers, bread, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.  

She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock for her store to sell.

In the future Nancy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Ladylou

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ladylou B. works hard to support her family.

She has a food production and sales business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store. Ladylou is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Ladylou has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley M. is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production business in the Philippines. Shirley has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from selling used clothes.

Shirley has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe A. is 35 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Fe has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

Ma. Fe is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Emilie

texts.en:
Emilie B. works hard to support  two children. She is married and has a sari-sari store and a frozen foods business in the Philippines.

Emilie requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove.

She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to save money by using the dried wood from her surroundings.

Emilie is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To buy an Envirofit cookstove.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en: Julita, a 58-year-old married mother of seven children, has been earning a living for the past 20 years by raising pigs in the Philippines. Having previously received and repaid 18 loans from NWTF, Julita is now requesting one for PHP 29000 to buy feeds and vitamins for her pig-fattening business. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream  to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pig-fattening business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is single and 18 years old. He is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns PHP 50,000 for each crop. John is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to pay for the laborers working on his farm and to buy fertilizers. John grows corn and has been doing this for two years. He wishes to expand his business farm site by purchasing land someday to help his parents improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for laborers

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita B. is 66 years old and married. Conchita works very hard.

She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. Conchita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, canned goods and other groceries. 

She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Conchita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie C., 43, is married and has eight children, five of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Annie has a business of selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. Annie has been in this business for eight years. 

She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell.

In the future, Annie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of fruits and vegetable to sell .

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta S. is 56 years old and married. She has seven children, one of whom is in school. Vicenta works very hard to provide for them.

Vicenta runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks and bread.  

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

In the future Vicenta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
