Tem tido um lucro de 7.000.00mt por mês com os lucros conseguiu construir sua própria casa que se encontra na fase da cobertura.



Este e o quinto empréstimo de Leonardo na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva. Os tres primeiros de (5.500.00, 10.000.00,e 7.000.00) forao usados para a venda de recargas. Os dois ultimos de 10.000.00 e 15.000.00 forao usados para dar continuidade da sua obra Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para montar portas e janelas na sua obra.
texts.en:
Armando Leonardo was born in Maputo. He is 45 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 16 and 18. All the children go to school. He takes care of his father, who lives in Inhambane, by sending him 1,000 meticais' worth of basic goods every three months.

Armando Leonardo left Inhambane to move to Namaacha District during wartime in search of work. For 12 months he worked as a domestic employee, then decided to start his own business selling prepaid Mcel/VODAcom phone cards and offering currency exchange. He has a good hold on the market because he makes sales at the border and cannot satisfy customer demand. He works from 7:00 am until 8:00 pm, when the border closes, and he has two employees. He makes a profit of 7,000 meticais per month, and he used his profits to build his own house which is ready for roofing.

This is Armando Leonardo's fifth loan with Hluvuku and his second with Kiva. The first three loans (for 5,500 meticais, 10,000 meticais and 7,000 meticais) were used to sell prepaid phone cards. The last two loans, for 10,000 and 15,000 meticais, were used to continue work on his house. He is confident that he will pay ahead of schedule and ask for another loan to put doors and windows on his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (blocks, nails, metal sheets, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a freezer to use in his butcher shop.

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison E. is now 41 years of age and married with four school-aged children. Edison is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns approximately PHP 8,000 per month. 

Edison is asking for a loan of PHP 16,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. Edison has been growing corn for almost 10 years.

In the future, Edison hopes to have a large corn crop and earn a higher income. He believes that he can improve the living conditions of his family through the continuous support and assistance of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita L. is from the village of Poblacion Aurora zamboanga del sur. She is 54 years old., married, and has three adult children. To make a living, Agapita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food and drinks to passengers in the bus terminal. Agapita has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Agapita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agapita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase candies, biscuits, and bottled water for sale. This loan will be Agapita's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase candies, biscuits, and bottled water for sale

loans.name: Razzok

texts.en:
Razzok D. is a hardworking man who has one child. His wife works in a maternity hospital and she has additional income from her services. 

Razzok is working as a taxi driver in the urban route. For five years he has been in this business. Besides this business he works as an electrician in his region. 

This year he plans to purchase an apricot garden and he will process his apricots. From the profits he would like to build a house. 

Razzok would like to get a loan of 10,000 TJS for purchasing the apricot garden in order to make a good profit and improve his life. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy an apricot garden.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella L. is from the village of Lubid, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 49 years old. Estrella is married and has five adult children. 

To make a living, Estrella makes and sells food and drinks for passengers in the bus terminal. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Estrella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Estrella is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to cook snacks for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Estrella from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to cook snacks for sale.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.pt:
Jaime nasceu no distrito de Namaacha, tem 34 anos de idade e separado  pai de 4 filhos de 6 aos 14 anos, todos vao a escolal.responsabiliza se pela sua mae que vive em sua casa e não consegue poupar nenhum valor devido a sua obra.

Devido a falta de condições financeiras Jaime não consegue concluir os estudos. começa a fazer mukero (venda de produtos contra bandiada) colectando um fundo para iniciar um negocio mas condigno, inicia com o câmbio de divisas actividade que exerce ate entao. Com  ajuda do seu pai que é proprietário de uma machamba em chokwe resolve explorar e começa a trabalhar com terra enviando lhe todos insumos e instrumentos agricolas, tem plantado tomate, pipino e batata doce. tem 4 trabalhadores que auferem por mês 1500.00mt por individuo, investindo no maximo um valor de 40.000.00mt e tendo um rendimento de 30.000.00mt. Mas devido a falta de mercado ele tem de alugar um carro que transporte os seus produtos de Chokwe a Zimpeto pagando em cada viagem um valor de 3.000.00mt. 

Este é o quinto empréstimo de Jaime na Hluvuku e terceiro com kiva. Os dois primeiros de(8.000.00, 10.000.00, 15000.00 e 20.000.00)mt forao usados para comprar material de construção. Este de 25.000.00mt sera para a mesma finalidade, Esta confiante que vai desembolsar antes do tempo determinado e pedir um novo emprstimo para reforçar mas o seu  negócio em chokwe.
texts.en:
Jaime was born in Namaacha District. He is 34 years old, separated, and has four children between 6 and 14 years old. All the children go to school. He also takes care of his mother, who lives in his house, and is not able to save any money because of his construction project.

Because of financial problems, Jaime did not finish school. He began working in mukero (selling contraband) and saving to begin a more legitimate business. He got started with currency exchange, which he has continued until now. With the help of his father, who owns land in Chokwe, he decided to explore and began working with land. He sends his father farming supplies and tools, and he has planted tomatoes, cucumbers and sweet potatoes. He has four workers who each earn 15,000 meticais per month, and he invests a maximum of 40,000 meticais and earns 30,000 meticais. But owing to the lack of market, Jaime has to rent a car to transport his products from Chokwe to Zimpeto, paying 3,000 meticais per trip.

This is Jaime's fifth loan with Hluvuku and his third with Kiva. The earlier loans (8,000 meticais, 10,000 meticais, 15,000 meticais and 20,000 meticais) were used to buy construction materials. This loan of 25,000 meticais will be for the same use. Jaime is confident that he will pay off the loan ahead of time and ask for another loan to stock his business in Chokwe.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (stone, cement, sand, blocks, etc.).

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy D. J. is from the village of Camanga. She is 31 years old. Mary Joy is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Mary Joy plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. Mary Joy has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Mary Joy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Mary Joy is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the first loan taken out by Mary Joy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Karubanda Twimukye Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
Lauben M. is the leader of the Karubanda Twimukye group of Kihihi. He is 45 years old and married. He and his wife have six children and four of them are still in school. 

Lauben has a carpentry workshop in Karubanda that has been in existence for over 20 years. He also does joinery in his workshop and he makes doors, windows, chairs and so on. As a result, he has a good customer base. He acquired the skill after working for someone else as well as being a farmer. 

He is hard working and very cooperative and his dream is to be able to expand his business as well as educate all his remaining children. 

He says that as a result of taking loans, his business has somehow grown and he needs a loan to be able to purchase timber for his business.

loans.use: To purchase timber for his business.

loans.name: Gansukh

texts.en:
Mr.Gansukh is 29 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. Gansukh was born in the countryside and his family moved to Darkhan in search of a better life. In 2004, he married his wife. His wife looks after the kids at the moment. 

Gansukh has been working at a mill factory as a flour packer since 2004. In 2011, he bought a plot of land and a small house with his savings. The house was cheap, but really run down and needs proper renovation and insulation from the cold. 

Mongolian winter is one of the harshest in the world reaching minus 40 to 45 degrees at night. Houses without insulation require burning coals for the whole night to keep the warmth. Plus it requires more use of coal, which is costly and pollutes the air and environment as well. Therefore Mr.Gansukh wants to do a proper renovation of the house, making it warmer. The loan will be used to buy all the necessary building materials to renovate the house and to replace the coal-fired heating system with a low pressure central heating system.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials to renovate his house and replace the coal-fired heating system with a central heating system

loans.name: Simon Maina

texts.en:
Simon has operated his retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past seven years.  He is 32 years, married to Teresia Wanjiku and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan.  He paid his previous loan well and in good time.  He plans to use this loan to buy more goods for sale in his retail shop.

In the future, Simon hopes to grow his retail shop to wholesale.

loans.use: to buy more retail products, such as rice, sugar and bar soap

loans.name: John Munga

texts.en:
John has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past 21 years.  He is 46 years old, married to Grace Wangui and they have four children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, John hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip M. is 30 years old and married with two school-aged children. Philip is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns approximately PHP 8,000 per month. 

Philip is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. He has been growing vegetables for almost two years.

In the future, Philip hopes to have a plentiful harvest and earn more income to support the education of his children. He believes that with his patience and strong determination, he can improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Calisto

texts.pt:
Calisto nasceu no Distrito de Manduimba, Provincia de Cabo Delgado Norte de Moçambique tem 45 anos de idade, é solteiro e pai de 1 filho que esta frequentando 3ª classe. Vive numa casa alugada e responsabiliza se pelo seu sobrinho que vive com ele.

Saiu de Cabo Delgado para a provincia de Maputo cumprindo com o serviço militar obrigatorio. Trabalha como professor de sargentos na escola das forças de defesa de Moçambique, naõ possui nenhum empregado e recebe um salario de 23.435,00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar alguma parte na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de seus colegas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este e o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 27.000,00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para concluir a sua casa e continuar com os seus estudos.
texts.en:
Calisto was born in the district of Manduimba, state of Cabo Delgado Norte in Mozambique. He is 45 years old, single, and father of a 3rd grade child. He lives in a rented house, where he lives with his son and nephew, for whom he is responsible for.

He left Cabo Delgado and moved to the state of Maputo to do compulsory military service. He teaches sargeants at the School of defense force in Mozambique, doesn't have any employees and receives an income of 23.435,00mt/month (545,48€/month), which he uses to pay housing expenses, and still manages to save some in his bank account.

He never asked for any other loan. He got to know Hluvuku through his colleagues who are also clients of this institution. This is first loan at Hluvuku, in the amount of 27.000,00mt ( 628,46€), with which he plans to buy construction materials (such as cement, sand, stone and others) to continue building his house.
He is confident that he will be able to pay it before deadline. After that, he plans to ask for another loan to finish his house and continue his education.

loans.use: buy construction materials (cement, sand, stone and others).

loans.name: Bernard Gichongoro

texts.en:
Bernard has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the last four years.  He is 39 years old, married to Jane Njeri and they have two children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD  by his friend and this will be his third loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow.

In the future, Bernard hopes to become a leading farmer in the Naivasha area.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Onjela

texts.ar: اونجلا عمرها 28 سنة هي متزوجة وام لولدان تعمل في صالون كوافير لها في عملها 11 سنة تحب عملها وتبدع فيه لأنها تجيده بشكل جيد تريد من خلال تحسين عملها الى تطوير المحل وتربية اولادها في ظروف مادية جيدة تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء معدات للمحل كراسي وصبغات واكسسورات ومكنة بخار تسعى الى تربية اولادها بشكل جيد من خلال تقديم كل ما لديها من عطف وعمل حتى تتمكن من تأمين ظروف معيشية جيدة لهم فهي امراة عاملة كادحة وتحب عملها وقد استطاعت ان تطور نفسها من خلال العمل لها زبائن من محيطها وجيرانها ولكنها تعاني من المنافسة الشديدة في محيطها وهي تحلم بأن تمتلك مكان اكبر حتى يتسع لعدد اكبر من الزبائن
texts.en: Onjela is a 28-year-old wife and mother of two wants to give her children everything she can to ensure a good upbringing for them. For the past 11 years, Onjela has been working at a hair salon, a job that she very much loves and excels at. She enjoys the patronage of many neighbors and fellow townsmen, although competition is not inconsiderable. Accordingly, Onjela was interested in obtaining a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase a few items for the shop, including chairs, dyes, hair accessories, and a hair steamer. Onjela ultimately hopes to one day own a larger shop.

loans.use: To purchase chairs, dyes, hair accessories for her hair salon.

loans.name: Peter Gikonyo

texts.en:
Peter has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the past four years.  He is 28 years old, married to Dorcas Wanjiku and they have one child.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of his friends and this will be his third loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Peter hopes to become a leading farmer in Naivasha town.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Milkah Muthoni

texts.en: Milkah, who has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years, was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Milkah hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and prepare land.

loans.name: Avelita

texts.en:
Avelita V., from the village of D ban Calamba Misamis Occidental, is 46 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Avelita owns and operates a specialized retail store selling manufactured native products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 12 years, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Avelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is requesting her eighth loan of 12000 PHP to purchase more native products to sell. Avelita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional native products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy construction materials (zinc plates, cement, sand, stone and others)

loans.name: Paul Kamau

texts.en:
Paul has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years. He is 44 years old, married to Esther Watetu and they have four children. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a friend, and this will be his fourth loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. 

in the future, Paul hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Kirehe Kwetungura Group A, Kihihi

texts.en:
B. William, 57, belongs to Kirehe Kwetungura group A of Kihihi. He is married with 4 children and he still pays school fees for three of them. 

He has been a tailor for over 20 years; mostly he has been selling school uniforms. Sensing that there was a ready market for clothes, William made a decision to start this business with capital from his farming business.

On a monthly basis, this tailoring business brings in 200,000 Ugandan shillings as profits. He says business expansion is next on his list objectives. He is also a farmer and sells produce to his local community. With this loan he says he is going to buy more clothes-making material.

loans.use: to buy more material for making clothes

loans.name: Khadija's Group

texts.en:
Khadija is a resident of Faisalabad, which is a big city in Pakistan and famous for its textile industry. She lives there in a two-room brick house with her family in the area of Mae-Di-Jughi. She moved here 25 years ago. She is 47 years old and married to M. N. with four children. Her eldest son is a factory worker while her elder daughter also works in a private organization. Her remaining two daughters are studying. Khadija is a housewife who stays at home and takes care of her children. 
 
Her husband has a job in the factory. His salary is not enough to meet the financial expenses of his family. So in order to supplement the income, he operates a donkey cart and offers loading services to the clients. Khadija has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy a new donkey cart for her husband because his current cart has become rough and needs to be replaced. By purchasing a new donkey cart, Khadija hopes that her husband will be able to put more loads on it and perform his work well. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In a previous loan year, she proved herself as a responsible client by paying her installments on time and by attending every meeting. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Khadija”.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Annah Mutile

texts.en:
Annah has been selling clothes in Naivasha town for the last two years. She is 37 years old, married to Patel Shilovele, and has three children. 

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by her friend and this will be her second loan. She paid for her previous loan well and in good time. She plans to use the loan to buy more clothes to sell. 

In the future, Annah hopes to grow her shop into a big boutique.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.en:
Edilberto is married and 49 years old. He has a retail shop where he sells vegetables and daily used products such as soap, shampoo and toothpaste in the local community. He has had this business for almost 10 years now.

Edilberto is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional items such as canned goods, biscuits and soft drinks that would increase the capacity of sales from his business. Each month he earns about PHP 5,000 doing this type of work.

In the future, Edilberto hopes to meet all his customer's demands for consistent, high quality products that would help to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as canned goods, biscuits and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar: علي عمره 30 سنة متزوج وهو اب لولدان يعمل في بيع الاقمشة والالبسة له في عمله 20 سنة يحب عمله وهو يطوره دائما من خلال البضائع التي يقوم بشراءها يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء اقمشة برادي له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة خيث ساهم القرض السابق في تحسين الوضع المادي له ولعائلته وفي دعم العمل وكان يلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلة يريد ان يزيد من مدخوله خاصة انه في صدد تجديد البضاعة بمناسبة الموسم الصيفي حيث يتطلب منه عدد اكبر من البضائع وفي نفس الوقت هو طموح يحب التجدد في العمل الابتكار في تصميم البرادي
texts.en: Ali is 30 years old and married with two children. He has been working for the past twenty years selling fabrics and clothing, a job which he is very much enamored with and which he is always trying to further develop by procuring new materials. He is very driven and loves being creative with drapery designs. With the summer season upon him, Ali is looking to renew his inventory. Given how his last loan from Al Majmoua helped improve his situation and that of his family, Ali now wanted to seek another loan to acquire more drape fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for drapery business.

loans.name: Oxidio

texts.pt:
Oxidio André Cuco nasceu na Cidade da Matola, Provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 29 anos de idade vive maritalmente pai de 4 filhos de  2 aos 12 anos. os três primeiros é que vão a escola. Fez 8ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condições finaceiras. Vive na casa própria com sua familia e sustenta sua mãe enviando lhe diheiro ou sexta básica mensalmente no valor de 1000.00mt.

 Muda se para Distrito de Namaacha com seus pais que foram transferidos numa missão de serviço. Ele junta se com sua esposa e fixa sua residência. Trababalha no Minicipio da vila há 1 ano como seguranca, em turnos das 7:00h as 20:00h no periodo da manha e das 20:00h as 7:00h no periodo da noite  tem um salário de 2,080,00mt  que aplica nas dispesas da casa e ainda poupa algum porque conta com ajuda da sua esposa que trabalha nas aguas da namaacha.


Nunca teve empréstimos em outros Bancos, conhece a Hluvuku atraves do seus amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva no valor de 15,000,00mt com aqual pretende comprar material de construção(cimento, barrotes e chapas de zinco) para dar continuidade da sua obra.o empréstimo anterior foi de (7.000.00 e 10.000.00)mt para a obra que agora se encontra numa fase de acabamentos.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tenpo previsto  para poder aceder a outros para construção de um estabelecimto de vanda de produtos comestiveis aumentando assim a renda familiar.
texts.en:
Oxidio André Cuco was born in the city of Matola, state of Maputo in southern Mozambique. He is 29 years old, cohabites with his girlfriend, and has 4 children, aged from 2 to 12 years old. Three of them attend school. He droped school after concluding 8th grade due to financial lack of conditions.He owns the house they live in. He also supports his mother, sending her money or supplies in the amount of 1000.00mt/month (33$).

He moved to the district of Namaacha with his parents who were relocated due to professional reasons. He then went to live with his current wife. He works at Town's Hall for a year as a security guard, working shifts from 7am to 8pm or 8pm to 7am. He has a monthly income of 2,080,00mt (68,63$) which he applies in housing expenses, and still manages to save some, because his wife works at Namaacha Water Company and helps with the expenses.

He never asked for any other loan. He got to know Hluvuku through his colleagues who are also clients of this institution. This is his third loan at Hluvuku and second one at Kiva, in the amount of 15,000,00mt (500$), with which he plans to buy construction materials (cement, beams and zinc plates) to proceed with the building of his house. His previous loans (231$ and 330$) were used in the building of his house which is almost finished.

He is confident that he will be able to pay the loan before deadline, so he can then ask for another loans to build a grocery store to increase his family's income.

loans.use: buy construction materials (cement, beams and zinc plates)

loans.name: Kirehe Kwetungura Group B, Kihihi

texts.en:
Annah B. is the leader of Kirehe Kwetungura group B in Kihihi. She is 37 years old and married with 3 children. Annah has had a retail shop in Kirehe for 6 years where she sells posho, beans, soap, jelly and so many other items. Her main customers are neighbors and people in the community. She is able to generate 120,000 UGX weekly. Annah also sells tea leaves since she has a tea plantation and it is from the tea sales that she got her capital. 

Annah is very hard-working and her dream is to have a wholesale shop and provide a high quality education for her children. Over the years, the loans have helped her to increase sales due to her ability to purchase more stock. Annah needs this loan to be able to restock her shop with more goods.

loans.use: to restock her shop with more goods

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is 31 years old. In order to financially support her family she sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and receives good number of orders every month.  She also does embroidery work if she gets any orders for that from her clients.
 
She is married to M. A. who is a driver and provides transport services to his passengers. Nasreen is the mother of five children. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her sewing business. Through the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine which will help her finish the orders on time and increase her profits. 

She is hopeful that this investment will help grow her business and help her enrolling her eldest son, who is now 5 years of age, in school. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she paid her installments on time and never missed any meeting. 

She comes from Faisalabad which is an industrial city and famous in Pakistan for its textile industry. She has been living there in a 2-room brick house with her family in Mai-di-Jughi for the past 13 years. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business.

loans.name: Erickson

texts.en:
Erickson G. is married with three-school-aged children. Erickson is a duck raiser working in the Philippines and has been doing this work for almost eight years. 

Erickson is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase feed and additional ducks for breeding. Erickson hopes this loan will increase his business operations. Currently, Erickson earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month in this field of work.

In the future, Erickson hopes to strengthen the business he manages and start another kind of business to provide for his children's educational needs  and give them a better future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ducks and feed

location.town: Mabasa, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals to sell

loans.name: Ruth Gathoni

texts.en:
Ruth has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 24 years. She is 53 years old, married to Michael K., and they have 3 children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and pay for labor.

In the future, Ruth hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for labor

loans.name: Asifiwe Group

texts.fr: Bahati est entrepreneur, Leader du groupe d’affaire « Asifiwe »,  âgée de 32 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants. Son mari est un Directeur Adjoint d’une école primaire Chidasa. La cliente est vendeuse d’huile de palme au marché sectoriel Nyabushongo.  Il ya 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle démarra son business avec  50$ reçu d’une commission d’affaire dans laquelle, elle a été facilitatrice. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  1 fus d'huile de palme à marchander.  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants et créer un mini quincaillerie.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire «  Asifiwe» est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en:
Bahati is an entrepreneur and the leader of the business group "Asifiwe". She is 32 years old, married, and the mother of seven children. Her husband is the assistant director of the Chidasa primary school. 

Bahati, the client, sells palm oil at the Nyabushongo sector market. She has been in this business for ten years. She started it with $50 received from being a facilitator. This new loan must serve her for one cask of palm oil to sell. In addition, her ambition is to expand her enterprise, to educate her children, and to create a mini hardware store.  

Bahati thanks Hekima for its work in favor of the poor who are excluded from traditional banks. It is appropriate to note that the business group "Asifiwe" is composed mostly of women.

loans.use: to buy one cask of palm oil

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mahabat's Group

texts.en:
Mahabat S. is the treasurer of this group. She is 37 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom attend school.  Her husband is a taxi driver.  In order to earn money to meet the family's needs, Mahabat together with her husband’s help breeds livestock. She is requesting a loan to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, Mahabat wishes to purchase a new vehicle for the family. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar: علي رجل متزوج وله ولد يعمل في دهان المنازل له في عمله 6 سنوات يتميز عمله بالدقة والمهارة والنشاط يريد من خلال المجموعة الى تحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي له ولعائلته يسعى من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة لاستلام الورش ودفع ما تبقى من ثمن سيارة يقوم باستعمالها في نقل العدة للعمل يسعى الى التطور التجدد في العمل له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه حيث انه يتميز بالدقة في العمل والمهارة وملاحقة التطور كان يتعرض لبعض الصعوبات المادية التي تقف حاجر في وجه تقدمه وتطوره لديه اللتزام كبير في عمله ولكنه يحب ان يطور عمله وان يزيد من مدخوله وان بعتمد على نفسه في تأمين العيش الجيد له ولأولاده
texts.en: Ali is a married father of one who constantly seeks to be self-reliant and to secure a decent life for his family. With customers hailing from his neighborhood and general community, Ali has been working as a house painter for the past six years, work to which he bears great rigor, skill, and commitment. Nevertheless, he has faced some financial difficulties which have hindered his progress. To this end, Ali would like to seek a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase wares for his shop and to pay off the installments on the car he uses to truck around his equipment.

loans.use: to purchase materials for house painting business and complete payment for the business car.

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene is married and 29 years old. She has a retail shop where she sells different products such as condiments, soft drinks, biscuits, sugar and different items needed in daily activities. Eugene has had this business for two years.

Eugene is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy additional soft drinks, biscuits, sugar, condiments and canned goods, which are important to her customers.

In the future, Eugene hopes to expand her business with additional groceries. According to her, her loan will surely help her in expanding the store.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cereal to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander comes from the village of Rodinauli, West Georgia. He is 40 years old and married. Alexander lives with his wife Vera, his parents and their two sons – 12 and 10 years old. Both of children go to school. 

Alexander works in a local asphalt factory. Also he is actively involved in the family's agricultural activities, which are led by Vera. The family has a small dairy farm, consisting of two cows. Vera produces cheese and sells it locally. Also, they own 1.25 ha of agricultural land where greens and vegetables are grown. Harvested products are sold to retailers of greens and vegetables. 

Alexander requested the credit for installation of the irrigation system in his farm. When the system is in place, the harvest of the family will increase and this will positively impact the income of the family. Alexander and Vera hope that they will have a good harvest and will be able to reinvest a part of the profit in farming activities.

loans.use: to purchase materials for irrigation system installation.

loans.name: Edward Ndungu

texts.en: For the last 31 years, Edward has made a living as a farmer in the town of Ndunyu Njeru. He is 65 years old, married to Dorcus Wanjiku and has four children. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and is applying for his first loan, which he will use to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm. His goal is to become one of the leading farmers in his area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Patrick Murithi

texts.en: For the last two years, Patrick has made a living by selling fruit in the town of Naivasha.  He is 32 years old, married to Agnes Kwamboka and has one child. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and is applying for his third loan.  He paid both of his previous loans on time and plans to use the new one to buy more fruit to sell. Patrick's goals are to grow his business and eventually buy a pickup truck to help him transport his goods.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Gulpotkan's Group

texts.en:
Gulpotkan E. leads this loan group.  She is 57 years old, married to a pensioner and is the mother of six children, three daughters and three sons. All of her children are married and most of them live independently with their own families (under Kyrgyz traditions the youngest son continues to live with his parents). Seven years ago, Gulpotkan went into business breeding livestock, reselling animals for a good price after spending a lot of time feeding and caring for them. She and her husband now earn 2,000 soms a month from their business and would like to buy a vehicle for their son to use. She will use her portion of this loan to buy more livestock to breed. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy livestock to raise and breed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow, seeds, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice and to pay for preparing his fields

loans.name: Miringu Maina

texts.en: Miringu, 59 years old, married to Hannah Wanjiru and the father of one child, has practised farming in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the last 30 years.  He  was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be his second loan, his first one having been repaid well and in good time. Miringu  plans to use the loan to buy seeds and employ manpower, and in future hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for labour.

loans.name: Bwashwa Tukore Group A, Kihihi

texts.en:
Amos M., the leader of Bwashwa Tukore group A in Kihihi, is 39 years old, married, and has three children. For over 12 years Amos, who has tea plantations, has operated an agricultural business selling tea leaves from Bwashwa, generating a monthly profit of 300,000/= . He is also involved in the sale of coffee since he also has a coffee plantation, and it is from the coffee sales that he earned the capital for his tea business.

Over the years loans have helped Amos to acquire stock and thereby increase his sales. A very hardworking man, he is now requesting a new loan to buy more manure for his crops, and his goal is to have more acres of tea shamba.

loans.use: to buy more manure for his crops.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.ar: ابراهيم رجل متزوج وهو اب ل 3 اولاد يعمل في حفر الاراضي ونقليات جرار زراعي له في عمله 6 سنوات يحب العمل ويرى فيه التطور والتقدم يريد من خلال تطور عمله ان يزيد من مدخوله وان يؤمن حياة كريمة له ولعائلته يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء جرار زراعي ودفع تكاليف ما تبقى من بناء منزله حيث انه لا يمتلك منزل خاص به فهو يسعى الى تأمين منزل سليم لأولاده انه يلقى الدعم من العائلة يمتلك خبرة ومهارة عالية في العمل ويبذل جهد كبير في تطوير نفسه وزيادة مدخوله يسعى الى شراء جرار حديث يواكب التطور
texts.en: Ibrahim is a husband and father of three who strives hard to develop himself and secure a dignified life for his family who are a great support to him. He enjoys six years worth of expertise in mechanical digging and transporting tractors, and he is keen to keep developing his career. To this end, Ibrahim would like to ask for a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase a state-of-the-art tractor of his own and to pay off the installments for a new house so that he can provide a decent homestead for his children.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor .

loans.name: Abraham Kinyanjui

texts.en:
Abraham is a shoe shiner in the town of Naivasha.  He also owns a retail shop in the same town.  He is 41 years old, married to Mary Wanjiru, and has four children.  In the future, Abraham hopes to expand his retail shop to sell goods wholesale.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend.  This will be his second loan and he will use it to buy more goods to sell in his shop.  Abraham successfully repaid his previous loan of KES. 15,000.

loans.use: to buy cereal to resell.

loans.name: Burambira Development Group A

texts.en:
Gad T., 43, is an enterprising business man with foresight.  He firmly believes in the future prospects of his general merchandise retail shop, which is located in Burambira in the Kihihi District.  The shop has been in business for over a decade and he believes it is destined for even more long-term success. 

Gad, a the father of four children, gleefully remarks that the success of the shop is due to the hard work ethic he has nurtured and embraced.  The store was launched with savings from his agricultural sales business.  The shop's weekly sales is approximately 180,000 shillings.  He will use the loan to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.name: Peter Ngugi

texts.en: Peter, who has operated a business in the transport industry in Naivasha for the last two  years, is 27 years old, married to Mary Wanjiru, and the father of one child. Introduced to KADET LTD  by his friend, Peter repaid his previous loan of KES.15,000 well and in good time. He is now requesting his second loan with which he plans to open a retail shop. In the future, Peter hopes to grow the new retail business into a wholesale operation.

loans.use: to open a retail shop.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is 36 years old, a housewife who lives with her family in a 2-room brick house in Faisalabad which is an industrial city and well known in Pakistan for its textile industry.  Her house is located in the area of Mae-di-Jughi where she came with her family some years ago. 

Her husband's name is M. H. and he operates a Punjabi food restaurant business. In his restaurant, he sells different types of tasty food items such as "Daal chawal" (made with lentils and served with rice) and "Nan Chanay" (made with chick peas and served with bread) to his clients. He believes in quality and good customer services; that’s why he has a good number of clients. 
 
Shazia has given birth to seven children. She is a very caring mother and takes care of her family very well. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband with the expansion of his restaurant business. Utilizing the loan money, her husband will buy required ingredients such as spices, cooking oil, lentils and chick peas, etc. to make good quality food to sell in his restaurant. 

Shazia is hopeful that after the loan investment, her husband’s business will grow further and his income will increase. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In  the previous loan year, she established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Shazia.

loans.use: To buy required ingredients for Punjabi food for their eatery.

loans.name: Samson Gitiha

texts.en:
Samson, who 43 years old, married to Peris Nduta, and the father of five children, has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years. He supplements his farm income by operating his motorbike for transport. Samson was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be his first loan with which he plans to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Samson hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara is a 50-year-old farmer from the village of Ilemi, Zestaponi District. She lives in the village with her husband Zaur. 

Gulnara leads the agricultural business of the family; Zaur has health problems and can’t intensively assist his wife. They own three milk cows, whose milk is used for cheese production. The cheese is sold on the local market. Also the family owns a vineyard (2000 grape vines); they sell grapes and wine seasonally. Along with the above-mentioned, Gulnara has two sheep and sells lambs seasonally. The total average monthly income of the family is 320 Laris. 

The credit will be used to purchase an additional milk cow. When the family has four cows, Gulnara will produce and sell more cheese. That will increase the income of the family. For the future Gulnara plans to invest more in her dairy farm and increase the number of her cows.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Monica  Waithira

texts.en:
Monicah has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 10 years. She is 42 years old, married to Boniface Mungai and they have six children.  

Monicah was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Monicah hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.ar: حسن عمره 42 سنة هو رجل متزوج واب لثلاثة اولاد يعمل في الجرارات الزراعية  له في عمله 5 سنوات يرى ان عمله هو من اهم اسباب تطوره يريد ان يزيد من مدخوله وتأمين حياة افضل له ولعائلته يسعى من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء جرار زراعي جديد متطور حتى يواكب التطور والتقدم يتميز بالالتزام في العمل والدقة والصدق ولكنه يواجه بعض الصعوبات المادية التي تقف عائق في وجه تقدمه له زبائن من مزارعي واقارب في محيطه
texts.en: Hassan is a 42-year-old husband and father of three who is committed to securing a good income to support himself and his extended family. For the past five years, he has operated tractors with superb dedication, thoroughness, and efficiency. He serves his relatives and several of the local farmers, although financial constraints have not permitted him to develop his work further. To this end, Hassan was interested in applying for a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase a state-of-the-art tractor.

loans.use: to purchase a state-of-the-art tractor.

loans.name: Susan Wambui

texts.en:
Susan has operated her retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru for the last year. She is 36 years old and a single mother of four children.

Susan was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more goods to sell in her shop. In the future, Susan hopes to expand her retail shop to wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more retail goods to sell.

loans.name: Bwashwa Tukore Group B, Kihihi

texts.en:
T. Eldah is the leader of the Bwashwa Tukore group B in Kihihi. She is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She has operated a retail shop in Bwashwa selling posho (a dish made from cornmeal), beans, sodas, soap, jelly, water, salt and many other items for 5 years. Her major customers are her neighbors and community members. She is able to generate 200,000 UGX monthly.

T. Eldah is also involved in the sale of tea leaves since she has a tea plantation. This contributes to her income and was the source of capital to start her retail shop. She is very hardworking and her dream is to have a wholesale shop and education for her children. The loans have over the years helped her to increase her sales, since she was able to stock more items. T. Eldah needs a loan to be able to restock her shop with more goods.

loans.use: To restock her shop with more goods.

loans.name: Samson Mwangi

texts.en:
Samson has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 10 years. He is 37 years old and single.

Samson was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer and cultivate the land for planting season. In the future, Samson hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and to cultivate the land for planting season

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more bags of tomatoes to resell.

loans.name: Houenoussou Ii Group

texts.fr: Le groupement HOUENOUSSOU II est composé de dix sept membres qui se connaissent parce que les membres de ce groupement habitent dans le même village à Allada dans le département de l'Atlantique. La présidente de ce groupement, du nom de Virginie, est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. Virginie est une veuve ayant à sa charge cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Virginie vit seule avec ses enfants. Virginie n’est jamais allée à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Virginie mène comme activité depuis huit ans environs, la vente d'huile de gas-oil à son domicile. C'est au marché de Allada que Virginie s'approvisionne. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Virginie et son groupe sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
TH. HOUENOUSSOU II group is composed of seventeen members, who know one another because they live in tH. same village in Allada, in tH. Atlantic department. TH. group's president, named Virginie, is tH. woman raising her hand on tH. picture.

In order to raise their level of activity to better meet demand from their customers, this group is requesting financial support from ALIDe. Virginie is a widow with five dependent children, who all attend school. Virginie lives by herself with her children. SH. never went to school. To provide for her own needs and those of her children, Virginie has been active for about eight years selling gasoline oil from her home. SH. gets her supplies from tH. Allada market. To strengthen their business and better satisfy their clients, Virginie and her group are requesting a loan from ALIDe. Their ambition is to increase their level of activity.

loans.use: to purchase three 50-liter jerrycans of gasoline

loans.name: Esther Muthoni

texts.en: Esther has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last six years. She is 40 years old and single. Esther was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan, which she plans to use to buy fertilizer, seeds and a bull cow. In the future, Esther hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and a bull cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new electricity generator and machine for the chickens

loans.name: Hanna Wangechi

texts.en:
Hanna has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last six years. She is 42 years old and a single mother of one child.  

Hanna was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan. She repaid her previous loan well and in good time. Hanna plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer, seeds and sheep to rear and sell later. In the future, Hanna hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and sheep.

loans.name: Peter Kairu

texts.en: Peter has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 10 years. He is 48 years old, married to Jane Nduta and they have one child. Peter was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this will be his first loan, which he plans to use to buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay for labur. In the future, Peter hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Viwanou Group

texts.fr: VIWANOU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent toutes dans le même quartier à Kpakpakanmey à Cotonou. La représentante du groupe Suzanne Fassi (qui a la main levée sur la photo) est née en 1968.  Suzanne Fassi est mariée à Valentin. Le couple a sept enfants, tous scolarisés, dont quatre à leur charge. Suzanne Fassi vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Kpakpakanmey. Il y a près de onze ans que la famille s'est installée dans ce quartier. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Suzanne Fassi vend depuis huit ans des bois de chauffage à Cotonou, ce qui lui permet de se prendre en charge. Suzanne Fassi s'approvisionne à Bohicon, dans le département du Zou au Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a bien remboursé les crédits antérieurs. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Suzanne Fassi s’est associée avec deux autres membres en vue de l’obtention d’un autre crédit.
texts.en: VIWANOU is a three-person group whose members all live in the same neighborhood in Kpakpakanmey, in Cotonou.  Suzanne, the group’s representative (whose hand is raised in the photo), was born in 1968.  She is married to Valentin.  The couple has seven children, four of whom they support financially.  All of the children are in school. Suzanne lives with her husband and children in Kpakpakanmey.  The family moved into this neighborhood nearly 11 years ago.  Together, the couple provides for the family’s various expenses.  Suzanne has been selling firewood in Cotonou for eight years, which enables her to support herself.  She gets her supplies in Bohicon, in the Zou department of Benin.  She is a longstanding ALIDé client who has fully repaid previous loans.  Her goal is to expand her business and to satisfy customer demand.  Suzanne has gone into partnership with two other members in order to obtain another loan.

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more foods and beverages.

loans.name: Samuel Mwangi

texts.en: Samuel has practised poultry farming in Naivasha for the last six months. He is 55 years old, married to Jane Wanjiku and they have four children. Samuel was introduced to KADET  LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use this loan amount to buy more poultry. In the future, Samuel hopes to become a leading poultry farmer in the Naivasha area.

loans.use: To buy more poultry.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Just like many micro entrepreneurs, Josefina Y., 53, ventured into sari-sari (variety) store ownership. Josefina graduated from college and is married to Ladislao, who is also a business person. Hand in hand they raise two children: one is in elementary school and one is not of school age. Their family currently resides in Silang, Cavite.

Josefina manages the sari-sari store on her own, opening daily and offering a variety of goods such as biscuits, candies, cupcakes, beverages and toiletries to cater to her neighborhood's immediate needs. She also sells electronic mobile phone loads for cellphone users in the community. Josefina has been in this business for 30 years and the store is located adjacent to their house for practical reasons. She earns a monthly net income of PHP 5,600.

Josefina has applied for a PHP 14,000 loan with the help of CCT*. She intends to use this loan to replenish her stock of goods, seeking quality and affordable brands for her customers. She acknowledges this loan as a big help to her and a way to increase her profits.

At present, Josefina also struggles with debts of customers who have the habit of escaping their bills. She finds ways to follow up on these customers regularly to solve the issue. It is Josefina's desire for her business and family to be successful and  strong in the years to come. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to replenish her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy headlights

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Albert Einstein once said, "Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow." This is what Gloria S., 60, does to make the most out of her life. At 60, Gloria has already lost her life partner. She currently lives with her children and young grandchildren in Silang, Cavite. Gloria finds fellowship and entrepreneurial training in CCT*, where she is one of thousands of Community partners.

Gloria is a fruit and vegetable dealer. She primarily sells tropical fruits like mangoes and pineapples, as well as fresh vegetables for every-day meals. Gloria's commercial space is located in another municipality; while she lives in Silang, her store is located in Kawit (still in Cavite). Monthly she earns a net income of Php5,400. 

Due to previous financial struggles,  Gloria decided to request a loan of Php10,000 to help her grow her business. She will use this to purchase more fruit and vegetables to add to the array of goods in her store. Gloria will only pick the freshest produce to sell to her valued customers. Gloria says that this loan will impact greatly on her business capital.

At present, one struggle she has is the long lists of debts accrued by some of her customers. Gloria will make use of her 38 years of experience in the business to solve this issue. She aims to improve her business and include more products to sell. Above all, she hopes that her children will be successful and that her grandchildren will finish their education. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Someone said that a person's success is not only measured by what he or she does in this lifetime, but by what that person imparts to the next generation. This is the reason that Yolanda G., 54, does well to improve her farm business--not just for herself but for her children as well. Yolanda's husband died a few years ago and, at present, she strives to raise their two children who are both in school. They currently reside in Silang, Cavite, south of the country capital, Manila.

Yolanda takes care of her own farm where she grows pineapples and bananas. When ripe, she sells these fruits to the community market and earns quite a lot. Also, she grows peanuts and sells them to business connections. This kind of business works as a lot of Filipinos love to eat steamed peanuts, fried peanuts and even peanuts turned into peanut butter. She also has a sari-sari (variety) store to cover whatever family needs remain. Yolanda earns around Php10,000 net income monthly.

To help her improve her peanut business, she decided to borrow Php30,000. She will use this loan in line with applying the entrepreneurial training she receives in CCT*. She will purchase necessary materials and acquire human resources to boost her peanut dealership. She says that the loan will largely support her business capital and enable her to make it grow.

At present, her difficulty is a low volume of product deliveries resulting is a low rate of sales. Nevertheless, Yolanda never gives up hope of making this business grow and continually strategizes for growth, because she knows this business will not only sustain her and her family now, but will be beneficial for her children in the future. She wants her eldest son to have a successful marriage someday. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to boost her peanut dealership

loans.name: Adjeniya Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ADJENIYA est composé de trois personnes qui vivent toutes dans la même localité à Sèkandji dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Rafiatou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Rafiatou est née le 11 Juin 1966 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin et est mariée à un démarcheur nommé Karim. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont trois à leur charge. Certains parmi les enfants sont scolarisés. Rafiatou et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Depuis près de six ans, Rafiatou vit à Sèkandji avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin de se prendre en charge et d'améliorer son niveau de vie, Rafiatou exerce depuis sept ans environs, comme activité la vente de produits de quincaillerie à Sèkandji. C’est au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, que Rafiatou s’approvisionne. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son fonds de roulement et son revenu, Rafiatou sollicite, ensemble avec son groupe, un premier crédit.
texts.en: The Adjeniya group is composed of three individuals living in the same area in Sèkandji, in the community of Sèmè-Podji. This is the first time that the group is seeking financing from  ALIDé,  in order to expand their activities. The group’s representative, by the name of Rafiatou, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Rafiatou was born on June 11, 1966 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, and is married to Karim, a vendor. They have four children, three of whom are still in the couple’s care. Some children are in school. Rafiatou and her husband jointly provide for the family needs.  Rafiatou  has been living in Sèkandji with her husband and children for almost six years. In order to support herself and improve her quality of life, Rafiatou has been working for about seven years as a vendor of hardware supplies. She stocks up in Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin. With the goal of meeting her customers’ expectations and increasing her working capital and income, Rafiatou, together with her group, is seeking her first loan.

loans.use: to buy hardware supplies

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa L., 49, exhausts all means possible to make her business profitable. Isay, as she is called by her fellow community partners, works hard to prove that not being able to reach college doesn't automatically mean a life of failure. She is married to Bernard, a watchman, and together they head a home of both children and grandchildren who are either working or attending school.

Isay runs her own sari-sari (variety) store where she sells grocery items. She also buys and sells jewelry and rents out an apartment. She has been in business for ten years and knows how to play her cards well. She earns around PHp80,000 monthly.

To help maximize her opportunities she has taken out a loan of Php50,000. She will use this to purchase ten sacks of rice, eight tanks of liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) for cooking, boxes of grocery items, and assorted jewelry items. She will make sure that the loan will result in an increase in sales and profits.

At present, Isay battles the issue of her customers' credit. Consequently, she resolves to cut the cycle of debt in her relationship with her customers. It is Isay's desire for her business to grow and become a complete grocery. She hopes to see her children finish school and, just like her, be able to maximize opportunities that come their way.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: purchase of rice and grocery items for stock replenishment

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
From a marriage turned sour, Edna P., 44, now shifts her focus to her children and business. Edna finished only high school but is striving hard to make her business work, as well as her relationship with her family. Edna is already separated from her husband and has children who attend school or are working. The family lives in Carmona, Cavite.

Edna has a sari-sari (variety) store. Aside from making sure her products are in line with the demands of her customers, she also takes good care of an apartment which she rents out. Selling electronic load for mobile phones is also a part of her business. She earns around Php10,600 monthly.

To help increase her business, she has applied for a loan of Php20,000 to purchase more grocery items including sacks of rice, cases of soft drinks, charcoal, a cell phone load, and a stock of SIM cards. Edna says the loan will help a lot in making ends meet. 

One struggle Edna has is the high cost of the products she sells. But given the loan, she believes that she will have increased sales and profits. Edna hopes her sari-sari store will grow into a mini grocery. To have her own home and make sure that her children are happy are her goals. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items for her store

loans.name: Salome Wangoi

texts.en:
Salome has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  She is 49 years old, and a single mother of four school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan. She repaid her previous loan of Kshs 20,000 well and in good time. She plans to use the new loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Salome hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 40 years old and married with three children. He sells scrap metals which are later used to make cooking pans, cooking pots and energy-saving cookers. He has been running the business for five years. In the future, he hopes to have a stable business. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kes to buy scrap metals.

loans.use: To buy scrap metals

loans.name: Vivi Group

texts.fr: VIVI est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et qui vivent toutes dans la même localité à Davatin à Cotonou (Capitale économique du Bénin). Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe s'est rapproché de ALIDé, en vue de l'obtention d'un troisième prêt. La présidente du groupe, Virginie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est née le 07 Juillet 1968. Virginie est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Tonny et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux restent à sa charge. Virginie s'est installée avec son mari et ses enfants ensemble à Davatin. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Virginie a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Virginie vend des tissus, des sacs et des chaussures de façon ambulante et aussi par le système de distribution. Virginie mène cette activité depuis  huit ans et qui lui procure des revenus l'aidant à subvenir à ses besoins. Dans le but de rehausser son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de plus en plus forte de la clientèle, Virginie sollicite avec les autres membres de son groupe, un crédit.
texts.en: VIVI is a three-person group.  The members are friends and all live in the same area of Davatin in Cotonou (economic capital of Bénin).  In order to boost their businesses and to better meet customer demand, this group approached ALIDé to obtain a third loan.  Virginie, the president of the group (whose hand is raised in the photo), was born on July 7, 1968.  She is married to Tonny, a shopkeeper, and is the mother of three children.  All the children are in school and the couple is still financially responsible for two of them.  Virginie, her husband and children have settled in Davatin.  Together, the couple provides for the various household expenses.  Virginie attended school for only a very short time.  To provide for her needs, she sells fabric, bags and shoes door-to-door and also by the distribution system.  Virginie has operated this business for eight years and it provides income to help her provide for her needs.  Virginie is asking for a loan with the other members of her group so as to expand her business and to better respond to the every increasing demand of her clientele.

loans.use: To buy fabric, bags and shoes.

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz comes from an industrial city of Pakistan known as Faisalabad. She lives there in a 2-room brick house in the area of Mae-di-jughi. She moved here 4 years ago.  She is 36 years old and married to I. H..  She has given birth to one son who is 20 years old and is a painter by trade. He paints houses and buildings. He works on daily wages and is known as an expert in his work.  

Mumtaz is a very supportive lady. She purchases clothes from the wholesale market and sells to her community clients. She offers a variety of clothes to her customers, that's why she has a good number of clients in her community area who trust her and buy clothes from her on regular basis.  She is also a housewife, performing her activities of a housewife very responsibly.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes-selling business. Through the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk and of different varieties. This will help her provide better quality and variety of clothes to her clients to earn better profits. She started this business two years ago and it has worked well for her. She is hopeful about her business growth.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.  

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Mumtaz.

loans.use: To buy clothes for clothes-selling business.

loans.name: Kiira Development Group

texts.en: S. Soprano, 46, with hand raised, operates a retail shop in Kiira in Mukono. He has been in this business for a decade and says it has been worthwhile. The father of five, he says he was inspired by one of his close friends to start this business.  Before that he was engaged in brick making. Monthly he says this business generates him shillings 150,000 and with this loan he will purchase more retail goods to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail goods to sell

loans.name: Mrembo

texts.en: Mrembo is 38 years old, married and blessed with two school-going children.  She does printing to earn a living.  In her business, she has employed two people.  Its has been four years since she started operating the business and she has witnessed a lot of growth since she joined Faulu Kenya.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has also been educated on business management.  She has requested a loan of 40,000 Kes to buy a computer and printer cartridges.

loans.use: To buy a computer and printer cartridges

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 43-year-old married woman living with her husband and one young child. She is from Lebanon. She has been working as a baker for over 15 years. She prepares delicious freshly baked goods. She cooperates with her husband who works as sweets distributor to earn good income in order to satisfy the family needs.

 With her requested loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, she will develop her shop and increase her productivity by renovating her tools and purchasing added products such as flour and thyme. She estimates that the loan will help her increase her profits by 15%.

loans.use: to renovate her tools and purchase added products such as flour and thyme.

loans.name: Kamel

texts.ar: كامل عمره 38 سنة متزوج واب لولدان يعمل تعهدات البناء له في عمله 12 سنة يحب عمله ويسعى الى تطويره وتحسينه له خبرة كبيره في مجال عمله حيث انه ورثه من والده وكان قد طور نفسه حتى اصبح يتعهد ورش لوحده فهو طموح مثابر ونشيط يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة شراء معدات للتعهدات وتسديد ما تبقى من ثمن غرفة النوم التي إشتراها لاولاده. يعاني كامل من نقص في السيولة المادية، التي تعيق تطور عمله والاعتماد على ذاته في تامين مستلزمات عائلته كاملةً
texts.en: Kamel (38 y.o., married, two children) has been working for the past twelve years as a contractor. After inheriting this career from his father, Kamel progressively built up his expertise until he could contract workshops on his own.
