This hamlet is part of the Tambogrande district, located 40 minutes from the department of Piura, and the main activities in this area are agriculture, stockbreeding, and traditional craftwork (pottery and metallurgy).

Vicente has been raising and selling pigs and goats for a living for the last two years. His corral is located in his backyard. He feeds his animals a balanced diet so that they can have optimum growth and he can sell them throughout the different markets of the area, thus obtaining good profits to cover his personal expenses.

Vicente has requested a 600.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can purchase well-balanced feed for his livestock because he wants to keep them well-fed with the aim of selling them at a good price to his customers who buy from him because they trust in the quality of his products, in so doing, he will improve his quality of life.

Vicente is a very hardworking and responsible person who only wants his business to keep growing and to give his parents greater comfort.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his pigs and goats.

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona comes from the village of Zanati, Abasha District. She is 52 years old and lives with her 26-year-old son and 25-year-old daughter. Madona works as a teacher in a local school. In addition, she is leading her family’s agricultural activities. Her son and daughter help her.

Madona’s family has small dairy and pig farms. They have three milk cows which give them 15 kg of cheese per week. Cheese is sold to the dairy products retailers. The family also sells calves on the local market. The pig farm consists of one pig and 15 piglets. The piglets are sold locally as well. The family also has 2 hectares of agricultural land where maize and soybean are grown. Half of the harvested corn is sold and the rest is used for feeding the domestic animals. The total monthly income of the family is approximately 1000 laris. 

With 60% of the requested credit, Madona will till and fertilize the land. After cultivation, maize and soybean will be sown. The remaining 40% will be used for renovation of the bathroom in Madona’s house. 

According to Madona’s estimations, she will get 7 tones of corn off the cultivated land:  4 tones will be sold, bringing in approximately 3,200 laris income for the family. With the profit, Madona will renovate other rooms of the house. This will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to pay for tilling the land and purchasing fertilizers, as well as materials and workforce for a bathroom renovation.

loans.name: Eduardo Rafael

texts.es:
Eduardo nació en la ciudad de Chiclayo departamento de Lambayeque, tiene 46 años, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad del Cusco. 

Eduardo es militar en el ejercito del Perú sede Cusco y desde 30 años que trabaja en el área de logística, pero él tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de zapatos de buenas marcas y ofrece sus productos mediante catalogo. Eduardo viaja y trae los zapatos de la ciudad de Lima. Eduardo tiene crédito con  la Asociación Arariwa, está muy contento de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal “Templo del Inca” porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, será para comprar zapatos.  

Eduardo es persona emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia y su sueño es abrir una cadena de venta de ropa y zapatos.
texts.en:
Eduardo was born in the city of Chiclayo, department of Lambayeque. He is 46 years old, has three children and lives in the city of Cusco.

Eduardo is a soldier in the Peru army, Cusco headquarters. He has worked in logistics for 30 years. He also runs a small business selling shoes of good brands, offering the products via catalog. Eduardo travels and brings the shoes back from Lima. Eduardo has had loans from Asociacion Arawira in the past. He is very happy to know he has financial backing and he has always shown to be responsible with his payments. He also enjoys being part of the "Templo del Inca" ("Inca Temple") community bank because all members are responsible and very supportive people. He would like to thank those who will be backing his loan request as it will be very useful in advancing his business. With the requested loan he plans to buy shoes.

Eduardo is an enterprising and hardworking individual who looks after his family. His dream is to own a store chain selling clothes and shoes.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: El señor Alejandro trabaja como profesor de computación. El crédito lo requiere para cubrir los gastos médicos para curar la rodilla que se lastimó. Vive en alquiler la misma esta ubicada en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. Alejandro es separado y  tiene cuatro hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Alejandro is an informatics teacher. He needs the loan to pay for medical attention he needs for his injured knee. He rents a house located in the region of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz. Alejandro is separated and he has four children. This is the second time he has had a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for medical attention he needs for his knee.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina nació en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 50 años y vive en la misma ciudad del Cusco junto con sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 30 años que se dedica a la artesanía y tiene un pequeño taller de fabricación de joyería. Ella siempre compra plata de 200 gramos para así abastecerse el negocio. Es una de los varios créditos que tiene con Asociación Arariwa, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal “Templo del Inca” porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará plata de 200 gramos para elaborar mas joyas como por ejemplo collares, anillos, pulseras y otras cosas más.
Cristina es una madre trabajadora que saca adelante a sus hijos y su sueño exportar a otros países.
texts.en:
Cristina was born in the city of Cusco. She is 50 years old and she lives in Cusco together with her 3 children. She has been making crafts for the past 30 years and she has a small jewelry workshop. She always buys 200 grams of silver to supply her business. This will be one of many loans she has had with Asociacion Arariwa (Kiva Field Partner). She is very happy to know she has this form of financial support and she has always shown herself to be responsible with her payments. She also enjoys being part of her communal bank, named "Templo del Inca", because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. She is thankful to those individuals who will contribute to the loan she requests. It will be very useful in the progress of her business. With the loan that she requests she will purchase 200 grams of silver to make jewelry, including necklaces, rings, bracelets, and other articles.

Cristina is a hardworking mother who provides for her children. Her dream is to export to other countries.

loans.use: to purchase 200 grams of silver to make jewelry.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria D. 57 años D. edad,  vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijos, la   misma que cuenta con  los servicios D. agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del caserío San Martín que pertenece al distrito D. TambogranD., a unos 40 minutos del departamento D. Piura.  Esta zona la actividad principal es la agricultura y ganadería y artesanía (alfarería y metalurgia).

Victoria desD. hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta D. ganado vacuno (vacas) y ovino (ovejas), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior  D. su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada pastos naturales y así puedan tener un crecimiento óptimo y luego pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados D. la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado Victoria un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 800 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados para su ganado y para realizar mejoras en su corral ya que alimentándolos bien con la y teniéndolos en espacios cómodos donD. puedan desarrollarse, podrá obtener un mejor precio en los mercado donD. los ofrece en venta a su clientela para  mejorar  su calidad D. vida D. su familia.

Victoria es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su negocio sea cada vez más rentable y brindarle mayores comodidades a su familia.
texts.en:
Victoria is a 57-year-old woman who lives with her husband and children in their own home, which has running water and electricity. They live in rural hamlet called San Martin, which is part of the TambogranD. district, located some 40 minutes from the department of Piura. The main activities in this zone are agriculture, stockbreeding, and traditional craftwork (pottery and metallurgy).

Victoria has been raising and selling cows and sheep for several years. Her corral is located in her backyard. She feeds her livestock a balanced diet and natural fodder so that they can grow optimally and she can then sell them throughout the different markets of the area. Thus, she can obtain good profits and cover the family expenses.

Victoria has requested an 800.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can purchase a balanced diet for her livestock and make repairs to her corral because by feeding the animals well and keeping them in a comfortable space in which to grow, she will be able to sell them to her customers at a better price, thus improving her family's quality of life.

Victoria is a very hardworking and responsible person who only wants her business to be more and more lucrative and to give her family greater comfort.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and repair her corral.

loans.name: Dania Marieta

texts.es:
Dania nació en la ciudad del Ayaviri departamento de Puno, tiene 49 años y ahora vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su único hijo. Ella es contadora público y desde hace 15 años que abrió su estudio contable. Ella tiene crédito con la Asociación Arariwa, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal “Templo del Inca” porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una computadora personal y otras cosas más. 

Dania es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que saca adelante su hijo y su sueño es seguir creciendo como persona y que su familia también progrese.
texts.en:
Dania was born in the city of Ayaviri in the department of Puno. She is 49 years old and today she lives in the city of Cusco together with her only son. She is a public accountant and 15 years ago she opened her accounting firm. She has accessed a loan through Asociacion Arariwa (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy to have this form of financial support. She has always shown herself to be responsible with her payments. She also likes to be part of her communal bank, named "Templo del Inca", because all of the members are very responsible and supportive individuals. She is thankful to al those people who will contribute to her loan. It will be very useful for the progress of her business. With the loan that she requests, she will purchase a personal computer and other products. 

Dania is a fighter and she is an enterprising woman who provides for her son. Her dream is to keep improving as a person and to continue to progress with her family.

loans.use: to purchase a personal computer and other products.

loans.name: Liduvina

texts.es: Liduvina tiene 35 años. Vive con su pareja y sus 2 hijos en casa de sus padres.Se dedica a la ganadería desde hace 10 años, ella adquiere los animales cuando tiene meses de nacido, aún por desarrollar a un menor precio, entonces se encarga de la alimentación y al cabo de un tiempo cuando ya tiene un peso considerado, es ahí que los vende a un mayor precio en las ferias ganaderas que se presentan en su ciudad. Cuenta con un amplio terreno, espacio suficiente para criar a sus animales. Considera rentable este negocio ya que le permite sostener a su familia e incrementar su capital de trabajo para tener más ganancias, por ello espero que le ayuden a dar un préstamo. Es su crédito número 7 con MFP, se siente muy feliz  de estar en su banco comunal de la que tiene experiencias positivas de trabajo y por la que se compromete una vez más a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de un toro.
texts.en: Liduvina is 35 years old and she lives with her partner and their 2 children in her parents' home. She has been a cattle farmer for 10 years. She acquires the livestock a few months after they are born to raise them and later sell them at a better price. So she takes care of their feeding and when they have reached a considerable weight she sells them at a better price at the farm fairs that come to the city. She has ample land, enough space to raise her livestock. She considers this business very profitable because she is able to support her family and to increase her working capital. For this reason she hopes to acquire a loan. This is loan number 7 with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy to be part of a communal bank because she has positive work experiences. She is committed once again to be on time with her payments.  With the loan that she requests she will invest in the purchase of a bull.

loans.use: to purchase a bull.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various items

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni  es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad que vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos (agua, luz y desagüe) en el distrito de Tambogrande a  tan solo 30 minutos de distancia del departamento de Piura. Esta zona se caracteriza por su actividad agricola, ganadera y el turismo.

Marleni  se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y es conocida por sus vecinos porque ofrece sus productos de casa en casa por todo su distrito.  Estos productos son para que las personas mejoren su imagen personal, en especial las mujeres y con esos ingresos se ayuda para sacar adelante a sus hijos y ayudar a su esposo económicamente.

Ha solicitado Marleni a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para adquirir más productos de belleza y ofertarlos a sus vecinos y tengan productos para escoger.  Con los ingresos de la venta de sus productos de belleza cubriría las cuotas del crédito brindado.

Marleni es una persona muy conocida por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y una buena madre al querer brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Marleni is a 30-year old mother who lives with her husband and 2 children in their own house, which has basic utilities (water, electricity, and a drainage system). They live in the Tambogrande district, which is 30 minutes away from the department of Piura. This area is known for its agriculture, stockbreeding, and tourism.

Marleni sells beauty products for a living, and she is well-known by her neighbors because she offers her products door-to-door throughout her district. These products are used to improve personal image, especially for women. With her earnings, she is able to help her children get ahead and help her husband out financially.

Marleni has requested a 1,000.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa in order to obtain more beauty products so that her neighbors have a variety from which to choose. With the profits she earns from these beauty products, she will cover the loan repayment.

Marleni is a woman who is well-known for being a hard worker, a responsible person, and a good mother who wishes to give her children a better future and to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Lidia Esther

texts.es:
Lidia nació en la ciudad del Huaro, tiene 43 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con sus 3 hijos. Desde cuatro años trabaja en la Organización Clásica (Clásica se encarga de vender utensilios de cocina).  Ella tiene crédito con  la Asociación Arariwa, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal “Templo del Inca” porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, será para uso personal específicamente para la educación de sus hijos y otra parte utilizara para ahorrar. 

Lidia es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que saca adelante sus hijos y su sueño es que sus hijos se han profesional.
texts.en:
Lidia was born in the city of Huaro. She is 43 years old and she lives in the city of Cusco together with her 3 children. For the past four years she has been employed by Organizacion Clasica (Clasica sells kitchen utensils). She has a loan with Asociacion Arariwa (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy to know she has this financial support. She has always shown herself to be responsible with her payments. She enjoys being part of her communal bank, named "Templo del Inca", because all of the members are responsible people and very supportive. She is thankful to those individuals who will contribute to the loan that she requests.  It will be very useful in the development of her business. She will use her loan for personal expenses, specifically for her children's education and a part will be used for savings. 

Lidia is a fighter and she is an enterprising woman who provides for her children. Her dream is to see her children have a career.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various articles

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la Señora Juana  le esta haciendo falta los acabados del exterior como es pintar las paredes, poner las ventanas, puertas y el piso de cemento al frente de la casa. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder realizar las mejoras que se vivienda necesita ya que desea que sus hijos y nietos tenga un lugar seguro y mas como para ellos. 
Pagara el crédito con el sueldo que recibe por limpieza de casa particulares. 
Ya que su esposo el señor Gerardo se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso que obtiene de su negocio de venta de tacos y platillos de comida preparada.
texts.en: Juana's home needs to have the exterior finished, including painting the ways, installing windows and doors, and a cement floor needs to be installed at the front of the house. She requests a loan to make these necessary home improvements. She wants her children and grandchildren to have a safe and comfortable place to live. Her husband, Gerardo, is in charge of the family's expenses with the income he earns from his taco and catering business.

loans.use: to have the exterior of her house finished and to install a cement floor.

loans.name: Rio Grande Las Gaviotas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Río Grande Las Gaviotas se llama así porque la mayoría de sus integrantes son mujeres y porque tienen la característica como las gaviotas de ser libres en su trabajo y enfrentar todos los obstáculos que se le presente, siempre tratando de volar lo mas alto que puedan por cumplir sus objetivos. Y también porque pertenecen a la población de Río Grande que significa “piedra parada”.

La representante de este grupo es la señora Gloria una mujer muy trabajadora quien vive en unión libre con el señor Juan, tiene 3 hijos. Tiene un negocio en su casa en el cual vende sopes, empanadas de pollo y tamales. Ella solicito el préstamo para comprar mas insumos para la elaboración de sus antojitos ya que quiere invertir un poco mas en su negocio, con el dinero va a comprar, hojas para el tamal, pollo, chile y maíz para los sopes y las tortillas que son hechas a mano. Ella tiene 30 años con su negocio y comenta que la muy bien ya que guisa muy rico y la mayoría de sus vecinos le compran sus productos y gracias a este negocio pudo mantener a sus hijos y darles una educación.

Las personas que integran este grupo son las siguientes:
Susana: Venta de zapatos
Rosa: Venta de pollos
Esbeide y Gloria: Venta de antojitos
Francisca y Gonzala: Venta de ropa
Marina: Venta de refacciones para bicicletas
Virginia: Venta de colchas por catálogos
Candida: Venta de joyas de plata
Susana: Venta de tamales y tortilla
Sebastián: Venta de tabiques 
T.: Venta de mariscos
texts.en:
The name of this group is "Rio Grande Las Gaviotas". It is called this because the majority of the members are women who are like seagulls for being free in their businesses and for being ready to face any obstacle that comes their way. They are always trying to fly as high as they can to meet their objectives. They belong to the community of Rio Grande, meaning "standing stone". 

The representative of this group is Gloria. She is a very hardworking woman who lives with her partner, Juan, and she has 3 children. She has a catering business in her house, serving sopes (corn bowls with various savory toppings), breaded chicken, and tamales. She requests a loan to purchase ingredients to prepare her recipes. She wants to invest a little more into her business. With the funds, she plans on purchasing corn husks, chicken, chili, and corn to make sopes and hand-made tortillas. She has been in the business for 30 years and she says that she is successful, especially because her recipes are so delicious. The majority of her neighbors buy her products and it is thanks to this business that she has been able to support her children and to send them to school.

The following are the members of the group: 

Susana: shoe sales
Rosa: poultry sales
Esbeide and Gloria: catering
Francisca and Gonzala: clothing sales
Marina: sale of spare parts for bicycles
Virginia: sale of blankets by catalogue
Candida: silver jewelry sales
Susana: sale of tamales and tortillas
Sebastian: brick sales
T.: seafood sales

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare fast foods, including corn, chicken, chili, cheese, and lettuce.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl tiene 19 años, vive en compañía de sus padres y en la propiedad de ellos. Desde su niñez ha trabajado en el camal (lugar donde matan los animales, entre ellos ovinos, vacuno, porcinos) apoyando de esta manera a sus padres. Con el tiempo vio una mejor opción que el tener un puesto de carnicería. Es así que vende carne, por considerarlo más rentable. De esta manera se establece su economía, actualmente cuenta con 4 toros que esta por vender su carne. Ahora su mayor prioridad es tener más animales para así subir sus ganancias. Es su primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, esta muy agradecido por la confianza depositada en su persona que le permite crecer un poco más en su negocio de la cual se siente satisfecho y comprometido en ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de un toro más.
texts.en: Raul is 19 years old and he lives with his parents in their house. He has worked in a slaughter house since he was a boy (location where livestock are killed, including sheep, cattle, and pigs). And this is how he helps his parents. With time he saw an opportunity to have a butcher shop. So he sells meats and he considers it to be more profitable. This has helped to establish his finances. He has 4 beef cattle and he plans on selling the meat. His greatest priority now is to have more livestock to increase his earnings. This is the first time he has acquired a loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he is very thankful for the trust imparted on him. It will help him further develop his business, with which he feels satisfied. He is committed to be on time with his payments. Witt the loan that he requests he will invest in the purchase of a beef cattle.

loans.use: to purchase a bull.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chicken for his business.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: Maria Concepción es soltera trabajadora lucha por tener un futuro mejor y tener todo lo necesario siempre con la ayuda  del todo poderoso, se dedica a la crianza de pollos, compra los pollos recién nacidos y los vende cuando estas grandes además de eso se dedica a la venta de oro brasileño  ente ellas cadenas aretes  etc. ya que es muy vendible lo compra la mayoría de señoritas,  y es excelente asiendo güipiles se tarda un mes en sacar uno de marcadores valorado en 1,500.00 . ella Solicita el crédito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos. lograr vender en estas épocas aretes para las señoras y señoritas que desean lucir bien y necesita comprar concentrado para seguir alimentando a sus animales. Su sueño es agrandar mas su negocio.
texts.en: Maria Concepción  is a single, hardworking woman who is striving to have a better future and to support herself, always with the help of the Almighty.  She has a business raising chickens.  She buys the newborn chicks and sells them when they are grown.  In addition to this, she sells items made from Brazilian gold such as necklaces and earrings, because these are easily sold due to the fact that so many women buy them.  She is also very good at making güipiles (embroidered woven dresses typical of Guatemala.)  It takes her a month to make one of these dresses using the Marcador technique of weaving, and they can be sold for about $150.  Maria requests a loan to buy supplies to make her woven garments.  In the current season she will sell earrings for women who want to look good, and she needs to buy feed so that she can continue to raise her animals.  Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make her woven garments, and to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
Luz Mery es una microempresaria que vive en el municipio de La Ceja en el departamento de Antioquia, desde hace 5 años trabaja confeccionando y vendiendo ropa para el hogar como: cortinas, sábanas, cobijas, cojines, toallas, manteles, entre otros. Esta labor la aprendió gracias a una hermana que igualmente trabajaba en el sector textil. 
 
Con este negocio Luz Mery genera sus propios ingresos para el sostenimiento del hogar, sin embargo ella quisiera ver crecer más su negocio, y así comercializar sus productos no sólo en La Ceja si no también en municipios aledaños, para ello, necesitará comprar suficientes insumos para que el producido sea mayor al que actualmente genera, y proporcionalmente aumentar las utilidades. Sin embargo sus ingresos no son suficientes para invertir esta cantidad de dinero, por lo que necesidad te un préstamo. 
 
Luz Mery sueña con tener algún día su propio almacén y así brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz Mery is a micro entrepreneur living in the town of La Ceja, Antioquia Department.  For the last five years she’s been making and selling linens for the home like: curtains, sheets, blankets, cushions, towels and tablecloths, among others.  She learned this occupation from one of her sisters who also worked in textiles.

Luz Mery generates her own income to support her home with this work.  However, she’d like to see her business grow more to sell her wares not only in la Ceja but also in adjacent towns.  To do so, she needs to buy sufficient raw materials so that production will be larger than what she currently generates and her profits will be proportionately larger as well.  However, her income is insufficient to invest this amount of money and this is why she needs a loan.

Luz Mery dreams with having a store of her own one day to provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make linens for the home.

loans.name: Maria Rafaela

texts.es:
María de 32 años de edad,  es soltero, tiene casa propia con servicio agua y luz, ubicada en el caserío de Valle Nuevo  que pertenece al distrito de Mochumí, a unos 20 minutos del departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

María se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral (gallinas y  pavos), su corral donde viven sus animales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta granos naturales.  Posteriormente vende sus animales una vez que hayan llegado a su tamaño y peso ideal en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Chiclayo y Lambayeque;  incrementando sus ingresos y obteniendo  cosas que le hacen falta en su casa.

El crédito que ha solicitado María es de 1200 nuevos soles a Edpyme  Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla, será destinado  para la compra de aves de corral para seguir negociándolo y así poder pagar su préstamo, lo que le ayudara  a mejorar su calidad de vida.

María es una persona trabajadora y empeñosa  que siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en su desarrollo personal.
texts.en:
María, 32, is single.  She has a house of her own that has electricty and water located in Valle Nuevo which belongs to Mochumí District and is about 20 minutes from Lambayeque Department.  This zone is dedicated to farming, raising livestock and tourism.

María raises barnyard fowl (chickens and turkeys) to sell.  The corral her birds live in is in her back yard.  She feeds them natural grains.  When they reach ideal size and weight she sells them in the various markets in the cities of Chiclayo and Lambayeque thereby increasing her income and obtaining the things she needs for her house.

The loan that María has asked Edpyme Alternativa through the Seed Capital program for is for 1200 new soles that she’ll use to buy barnyard fowl to continue selling in order to be able to repay the loan and which will help her improve her quality of life.

loans.use: Comprar más aves de corral

loans.name: Vilma Patricia

texts.es:
Desde hace 6 años Vilma y su esposo trabajan en su propio negocio, un restaurante que presta el servicio de alimentación y  hospedaje a camioneros que transitan por el sector de Don Matías, municipio del departamento de Antioquia, donde está ubicado su negocio. Vilma es madre de 2 hijos y su mayor propósito es brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y aunque su dedicación y esfuerzo sumado a la buena atención y al amor por lo que hacen les permite generar ingresos mensuales que les da para vivir supliendo sus necesidades, esta emprendedora   se fijó la meta de llegar a ser el más reconocido y el preferido del sector, reforzando los servicios de alimentación, las habitaciones, la higienes y sobretodo la familiaridad que se le brinda a los cliente cuando llegan al lugar. 
 
Para empezar a trabajar en la consecución de sus metas, deberán hacerle algunas adecuaciones al lugar como pintar nuevamente las instalaciones, comprar mobiliarios, y surtido para el restaurante, una inversión necesaria y benéfica para el mejoramiento del lugar y sus servicios, pero Vilma necesitará un crédito ya que hoy en día no cuenta con el capital para realizar dicha inversión.
texts.en:
For 6 years, Vilma and her husband have worked in their own business, a restaurant where they provide food service and lodging to the truckers who pass through the Don Matias area, a municipality in the department of Antioquia where their business is located.  Vilma is the mother of 2 children, and her main goal is to provide them with a better quality of life.  Her dedication and effort, combined with good service and a love for what she does, allows her to generate monthly income to meet the basic needs of her family.  This enterprising woman has set a goal of becoming the most well-known and preferred boardinghouse in the area, by improving the quality of her food service, the rooms, the hygiene, and most of all, the feeling of comfort she provides to the customers when they come to her place.

To start working on achieving these goals, she must make some improvements to the business, such as repainting the premises, buying furniture, and buying supplies for the restaurant.  This investment is needed, and will benefit the business by improving the premises and the services.  But Vilma needs a loan to do this, because she lacks the capital to make this investment on her own.

loans.use: to make improvements to her boardinghouse/restaurant and buy supplies

loans.name: El Mirador Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama El Mirador se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de San Pedro Apatlaco, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, está integrado por la señora Cristina va a comprar con su crédito Pan, un triciclo y bolsas, la señora Rubicela va a comprar un carrito para vender sus tacos, la señora Roció va a comprar jabón, semillas, chiles secos, refrescos, huevo, azúcar, la señora Juana va a comprar botellas y esencias para la venta de artículos de limpieza, la señora Ariana va a comprar chicharrones, hielo, azúcar, verdura  para iniciar su negocio, la señora Roció tiene 22 años de edad, ella estudio hasta el 3er. año de secundaria, ella vive en unión libre, tiene 2 hijas Evelyn de 6 años de edad está en preescolar y Giovana de 2 años 4 meses de edad, ella tiene su tienda de abarrotes, se llama la Escondida, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar mercancía refrescos, huevo, azúcar, jabón, aceite, semillas, chiles secos, papel higiénico etc. Ella inicio su negocio hace 3 años, su esposo fue el de la idea, el tenia una panadería en la ciudad de México donde elaboraba  pan chino, pero la vendió y se vino a radicar para Cuautla con eso compro el terreno, construyo y comenzó a comprar mercancía para la tienda, lo que más le gusta de su negocio es que gana dinero, que le va bien en el negocio y que está en su casa y puede atender a sus niñas, las ganancias del negocio las vuelve a invertir comprando mas mercancía, en los gastos de la escuela de su niña y en la comida, sus sueños y esperanzas son construir el 2º. Piso de su casa. San Pedro Apatlaco es bonito, tranquilo, es campo siembran caña, milpa, cebolla, jícama. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad Gracias por sus préstamos por que si nos van a ayudar a crecer nuestros negocios”.
texts.en:
The name of this group is "El Mirador", meaning "The Lookout". It is located in the community of San Pedro Apatlaco, Ayala in the state of Morelos, Mexico. The following are members of the group: 

Cristina will purchase bread, a tricycle, and bags with her loan. 

Rubicela will purchase a cart from where to sell her tacos. Rocio will purchase soap, seeds, dried chili, soft drinks, eggs, and sugar. 

Juana will purchase bottles and fragrances to make cleaning supplies. 

Ariana will purchase pork rinds, ice, sugar, and vegetables to start her business. 

Rocio is 22 years old and she has a grade 9 education. She lives with her partner and she has 2 daughters. Evenlyn is 6 years old and she is in preschool and Giovana is 2 years and 4 months old. She has a grocery store named "Escondida". She requests a loan to purchase merchandise, including soft drinks, eggs, sugar, soaps, cooking oil, seeds, dried chili, bathroom tissue, etc. She started her business 3 years ago although it was her husband's idea. He had a bakery in Mexico City where he made Chinese bread, but he sold the business with the money he bought land in the city of Cuautla. He built a house and started to purchase merchandise for the store. What she most enjoys about the business is that she earns an income and the business is profitable. And because it is in her house she is able to take care of her daughters.  The profits from her business are reinvested into the purchase of more merchandise, to pay for her daughter's school expenses, and for food. Her hopes and dreams are to build a second floor to her house. 

San Pedro Apatlaco is beautiful and tranquil. It is a rural region where sugar cane, onions, and jicamas are cultivated.  The members of the group want to say to Kiva and to Fundacion Realidad (Kiva Field Partner), "Thank you for the loans because it will help us to develop our businesses".

loans.use: to purchase soaps, seeds, dried chili, soft drinks, eggs, and cooking oil to supply her business.

loans.name: Elva Rossana

texts.es:
Elva  de 35 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de su  madre junto con sus  hermanas, su casa es propia la cual cuenta con los servicios básicos de agua y luz, en la parte anterior  de su domicilio ha colocado  su tienda, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Guadalupe a  30 minutos de la provincia de Pacasmayo y a 2 horas del  departamento de la Libertad.  Estas zonas se caracterizan por su alta actividad comercial, agrícola, ganadera y turística  que desarrollan sus pobladores.

Elva se dedica  a la venta de productos de primera necesidad (leche, azúcar, arroz, detergente,  frugos,  golosinas, etc.), en la cual sus  vecinos encuentran toda clase de productos comestibles, con su negocio que tiene trata en lo posible de tener  un mejor nivel de vida.

Mediante una visita a Edpyme Alternativa Elva trata de adquirir un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para abastecer su tienda de más insumos y así pueda satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, y de paso incrementar  sus ingresos para cubrir su crédito y sacar adelante su negocio.
texts.en:
Elva, 35, is single and lives in her mother’s house together with her sisters.  The house is theirs and is has water and electricity.  She’s has installed her store in the front part of the house which is located in the rural part of Guadalupe District 30 minutes from Pacasmayo Province and two hours from La Libertad Department.  These zones are characterized by the high level of commercial activity, farming, raising livestock and tourism the residents are involved in.

Elva sells basic need items (milk, sugar, rice, detergent, fruit, snacks, etc.)   Her neighbors find all kinds of food items in her store.  With her business she tries to have a better standard of living.

Through a visit to Edpyme Alternativa Elva tries to acquire a 500 new sol loan to stock her store with more products to meet customer demand thus increasing her income to repay the loan and move her business forward.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Juana Aristina

texts.es: Juana Aristina se dedica a una pulpería. Es una persona muy honesta por lo que se siente muy orgullosa de obtener un medio de ingreso para su familia. Su negocio lo aprendió por su Mama fue ella quien le enseño a Juana a ganarse la vida  con este ingreso, pues a pesar de que no ha sido fácil mantener el negocio, por la gran competencia que existe es por eso que ella decide realizar este financiamiento con el fin de invertir en la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, golosinas, refrescos, sopas, fósforos, papel higiénico y desodorantes.
texts.en: Juana Aristina has a grocery store. She is a very honest person which is why she always feels proud to earn an income for her family. She learned the business from her mother. She taught Juana to earn a living through this business. It has not been easy to maintain the business for the high level of competition. For this reason she has decided to access this loan. Her goal is to invest in the purchase of basic grains, detergents, sweets, soft drinks, soups, matches, bathroom tissue, and deodorants.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, detergents, sweets, soft drinks, soups, matches, bathroom tissue, and deodorants to supply her business.

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en:
Malkhaz is a 34-year-old farmer from the village of Japana, West Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife Mary, his parents, a 7-year-old daughter and a 2-year-old son. 

All the adult members of the family are involved in agriculture. In particular, they have a dairy farm with four milk cows. Mary and her mother-in-law produce approximately 70 kg of traditional Georgian cheese per month with the milk and sell it at the local market. The family also owns 2.5 hectares of agricultural land, 1 hectare of which is used for growing watermelon. They harvest 20 tones of fruit which is sold to the wholesalers. Another 1 hectare is used for maize:  3 tones are harvested each year, 1.5 tones of which is sold locally and the remaining 1.5 tones is used in the dairy farm for feeding cows and calves. On the remaining 0.5 hectares, various vegetables are grown, which are sold at the local market. 

Malkhaz requested a loan for cultivation of the land and purchasing watermelon seeds. With cultivation and quality seeds, Malkhaz expects to harvest 30 tones of watermelons (10 tones more that usual). The harvest of maize will increase to 5 tones. 

This family has also planned how they will invest the profit. They will buy a personal computer for their daughter, purchase an additional cow for dairy farm expansion and perform some renovation work on the house.

loans.use: to pay for tilling the land and watermelon seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar más prendas de vestir.

loans.name: Reynas De Jamiltepec Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Las Reynas de Jamiltepec porque las integrantes de este grupo se consideran unas mujeres que siempre destacan por ser muy trabajadoras y se consideran las reynas de su negocio. Y esta integrado por 11 mujeres que se dedican a diferentes actividades y son las siguientes: Teresa (Elaboración de tortillas), Yadira, Antonia, Ines y Alberta (Venta de ropa), Ana, Maria y Antonia (Venta de comida), Reynalda (Venta de calzado y ropa), Maria (Venta de perfumes), Honorina (Venta de abarrotes).

La señora Reyna esta casada con el señor Feliz, tienen 2 hijos de los cuales 1 estudia la preparatoria y el otro la secundaria. Ella tiene su negocio de venta de ropa y calzado para mujeres y hombres, solicitó el préstamo para comprar más mercancía y así surtir su negocio que tiene en el mercado. Con el crédito va a comprar: shorts, blusas, faldas, pantalones, zapatillas, zapatos, sandalias entre otros. 

Ella tiene su negocio desde hace 4 años inicio con el porque se vio  en la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de sus hijos porque había ocasiones que no le alcanzaba el dinero para comprar todo lo que necesitaba su hijo. Ella renta un pequeño local en el mercado pero comenta que a veces las ventas son muy escasas debido a que existen varias personas que venden las mismas mercancías y tiene que salir a vender sus productos de manera ambulante y de esa manera tiene más clientes y sus ventas son mucho mejor. Este crédito lo invertirá en su negocio para así tener un poco más surtido su negocio y poder obtener más ganancias para los gastos de su hogar.

Ella comenta que su negocio la ayudado mucho económicamente y de igual manera la ayudado a conocer más personas y hacer amistades. Ella esta agradecida con Dios por las bendiciones que le da todos los días y porque le valla bien en sus ventas para que a sí tenga dinero para llevar el alimento a su casa.
Su más grande meta es hacer su propio local en su casa y que sus hijos estudien una profesión y tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
This group is named "Las Reynas de Jamiltepec", meaning "The Queens of Jamiltepec". It is named as such because the members of this group are known to be very hard workers and they consider themselves to be the queens of their businesses. It is made up of 11 women who carry out different business activities, which are the following: 

Teresa: tortillas sales
Yadira, Antonia, Ines, and Alberta: clothing sales
Ana, Maria, and Antonia: catering
Reynalda: shoe and clothing sales
Maria: perfume sales
Honorina: grocery store

Reyna is married with Feliz and they have 2 children. One is in college and the other is in high school. she has a  shoe and clothing business for ladies and gentlemen. She requested a loan to purchase more merchandise to supply her business. It is located in the market. With her loan she will purchase shorts, blouses, skirts, pants, pumps, shoes, sandals, and other items.

She has had her business for 4 years and she started out because she saw the need to help her husband with their children's expenses. There were times when they did not have enough money to purchase all their son needed. She rents a small store space in the market but she says that sometimes sales are very low given that the are various other people that sell the same type of merchandise. She has to go out and sell her merchandise itinerantly in order to have more clients and to improve her sales. This loan will be invested in her business, to have a better selection and to increase her earnings for the household expenses.

She says that her business has helped her a great deal financially and it has also helped to know more people and to make new friends. She is thankful to god for the blesses that He gives her every day and because her sales are good, which will earn money to buy food for their family.

Her greatest goal is to set up her own store space in her house and to see her children study to have careers to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale, including blouses, t-shirts, pants, and skirts.

loans.name: Abigail Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Abigail decidieron ponerle así porque así se llama la hija de una de las integrantes del grupo y porque les pareció un bonito nombre. Este grupo esta integrado por 10 personas de la cuales la mayoría tiene un negocio y 3 personas piensan iniciar un negocio para apoyar  a sus familias. A continuación mencionare a las personas que integran este grupo: Isaac (Venta de antojitos), Adelina e Ivett (Venta de calzado), Yanet, Guadalupe y Marcelina (Venta de ropa), Guadalupe y Minerva (Venta de cosméticos), Andrés (Venta de abarrotes), Yolanda (Venta de ropa típica).

Yolanda es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella una joven soltera que se dedica al bordado y tejido, realiza blusas, fundas para botellas, servilletas, cinturones, entre otros.
Ella solicito el préstamo para comprar hilos de estambre de diferentes colores, hilos de seda de diferentes colores ya que es la herramienta principal para elaborar sus productos y como en esta ocasión tiene un pedido que entregar y le hace falta dinero para comprar algunos materiales. Ella tiene 4 años con este negocio, sus productos los ofrece con sus amistades y familiares  y solo cuando le hacen un pedido para una boda, bautizo, primera comunión, cumpleaños o quince años ella vende sus productos ya que es cuando mas le encargan mercancía.

Para ella este negocio es muy importante ya que con el puede solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a sus padres.
Yolanda esta muy contenta con este préstamo porque con ello va a poder realizar sus productos para realizar su pedido y con ello podrá obtener ganancias.
Su meta es engrandecer su negocio y aprender a realizar otras cosas nuevas para así tener variedad en sus productos.
texts.en:
The name of this group is Abigail and they decided on this name because that is the name of a daughter of one of the members of the group and because they thought the name was pretty. this group is made up of 10 individuals. The majority have their own business and 3 are thinking about starting a business to support their families. Here we will list the members of the group: 

Isaac: fast food sales
Adelina and Ivett: shoe sales
Yanet, Guadalupe, and Marcelina: clothing sales
Guadalupe and Minerva: cosmetics sales
Andres: grocery store
Yolanda: traditional clothing

Yolanda is a member of the group. She is a young, single woman who embroiders and knits blouses, bottle covers, napkins, belts, and other items. 

She requests a loan to purchase yarn in various colors an silk threads of different colors. This is the material that she uses to make her products. At this time she has an order but she doesn't have the money to purchase some materials. She has 4 years in the business, selling her products to her friends and family. She only sells for special occasions, such as weddings, baptisms, first communions, birthdays, and sweet sixteen parties. She sells her products then because that is when the orders are the largest.

This business is very important because through it she is able to cover her personal expenses and to help her parents. 

Yolanda is very happy with this loan because with it she will be able to purchase the products she needs to fill her order, and to earn her pay.

Her goal is to expand her business and to learn to make new things to add variety to her products.

loans.use: to purchase colored threads and fabrics to make traditional clothing.

loans.name: Frente Al Sol Group

texts.es:
El grupo Frente al Sol esta integrado por 11 mujeres que se dedican al trabajo diario para sostener a sus familias, el grupo se llama así por que en el lugar donde se reúnen las personas está al descubierto y en las mañanas se puede apreciar el iN. de la mañana y del nuevo sol.
Brígida es una de la integrantes de este grupo, tiene 39 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Bernabé, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 ya están casados y 2 estudian la Primaria. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 2 años, ella iN. con este negocio porque en su casa se aburría mucho y ella necesitaba realizar hacer algo para distraerse y es por ello que empezó a vender ropa, al principio vendía poco ya que solo vendía con sus vecinas y familiares pero con el transcurso del tiempo han incrementado sus ventas ya que ahora sale a otras poblaciones para vender sus productos, para ella es  muy importante este negocio ya que aparte de que ocupa su tiempo, obtiene ganancias para los gastos escolares de sus 2 pequeños hijos y también para los gastos de su hogar.
Brígida solicito el crédito para comprar más ropa; ya que es la temporada en que la venta es muy buena y necesita tener mas surtido es por ello que comprara: blusas, faldas, playeras, camisetas, calzones, pantalones, gorras y con ello podrá surtir más y proveerles mas productos a sus clientes ya que ellos son el motivo importante por el cual su negocio sigue creciendo. 
Ella comenta que le va muy bien en su negocio aunque hay ocasiones en que esta un poco triste y casi no hay ventas pero en otras ocasiones se recupera y le va muy bien; ella espera que le valla muy bien esta ocasión para que así pueda realizar sus pagos y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar. 
Su deseo más grande es que sus hijos realicen una carrera y que estén bien de salud ya que son lo más importante de su vida.
El grupo frente al sol agradece por el apoyo atorgado por que gracias a ello pueden surtir de nuevo en su negocio y así podrán ir creciendo cada vez más. Sus integrantes son: Claudia, Alberta, Leonarda y Gudelia (Venta de antojitos), Patricia (Venta de calzado), Trinidad, Martha y Brígida (Venta de ropa), Laura (Venta de dulces), Lucia (Venta de pescado), Ana (Venta de perfumes).
texts.en:
The group named "Frente al Sol", meaning "Facing the Sun" is made up of 11 women who works every day to support their families. The group was named this because the location where they meet is in the open and in the mornings one can appreciate the start of a new day and the rising sun. 

Brigida is one of the members of the group. She is 39 years old and she is married with Bernabe. She has 4 children, 2 of whom are married, and 2 are in primary school. She has been selling clothing for 2 years. She started the business because she used to get bored at home and she needed to do something to keep her occupied, so she started to sell clothing. At the start her sales were low because she only sold to her clients and family but with the passage of time her sales have been increasing. She goes out to other communities to sell her products. This business is very important to her, not only because it occupies her time but also because it helps with the school expenses of her 2 young children and with the household expenses.

Brigida requests a loan to purchase more clothing. This is the season when sales are very good and she needs to have more variety. She will purchase: blouses, skirts, beach shirts, t-shirts, undergarments, pants, and hats.  She will increase the variety the products to offer her clients, as they are the most important reason why her business has been increasing. 

She comments that her business has been doing very well, although there are times when it is a little quiet and there are almost no sales. But during other times she is able to recover and it has gone very well. She hopes that it will go well so that she will be able to make her payments and to help her husband with the household expenses. 

Her greatest dram is to see her children earn a career and to be in good health, which are the most important things in life. 

The group "Frente al Sol" is thankful for the support granted to them and it is thanks to this that they will be able to revitalize their business and to keep it growing. The following is a list of the members: 

Claudia, Alberta, Leonarda and Gudelia: fast food sales
Patricia: shoe sales
Trinidad, Martha and Brigida: clothing sales
Laura: sweets sales
Lucia: fish sales
Ana: perfume sales

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale, including blouses, skirts, t-shirts, and pants.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy baskets of dried fish to add to her business

loans.name: Duo Eva Group

texts.es: Duo Eva: este Grupo esta Formado por dos señoras, Ana leticia D. 23 años D. edad es dueña D. una tortilleria el su comunidad donD. vive desD. hace mas D. 3 años ella nos cuenta que nececita este credito para la compra D. maiz y leña para continuar con su negocio. tambien eta doña Rosa Maria,D. 42 años D. edad y se dedica a la crianza D. animales en su comunidad donD. vive ella nos cuenta que nececita este credito para la compa D. pollos para la venta ya que por este tiempo los compra mas barato ella nos cuenta que tambien quere comprar gallinas D. granja para poder vender huevos y asi obtener mas ganacias y apoyar a sus hijos que estan estudiando ya sque nececitan muchas cosas y pasajes todos los dias para ir a la escuela su sueño es que sus hijos puedan ser buenos profecionales para tener mejores oportunidades en un futuro.
texts.en: Duo Eva: this group is maD. up of two women:One is Ana Leticia, 23, who owns a tortilla store in the town where she has lived for the last 3 years.  She tells us that she needs the loan to buy corn and firewood so she can continue with her business.  The other is Maria, 42, who raises animals in the village where she lives and she tells us that she needs the loan to buy chickens to sell since it is the period when they are cheaper.  She also says that she wants to purchase laying hens so the she can sell eggs and earn more and support her children who are in school.  The children need many things as well as transportation fare every day to go to school.  Her dream is that they can become successful professionals to have better opportunities in the future.

loans.use: To buy corn and firewood for a tortilla shop and to buy chickens to sell

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier tiene 36 años, vive con su esposa y su hijo temporalmente en casa de sus padres. Hace más de 6 años ofrece el servicio de construcción, como casas u obras públicas, de acuerdo como le requiera el cliente que le contrata, su pasión por el trabajo es tratar en lo posible de terminarlo en el menor tiempo para así cumplir con el cliente. Dispone de sus propias herramientas de trabajo que le permiten ofrecer un servicio de calidad y por ello es que lo conocen en su comunidad, como el mejor maestro de obras. En estos últimos meses ha estado con muchos contratos y eso le favorece en sus ganancias ya que puede así sostener a su familia y continuar en la construcción de su propia casa que es uno de sus grandes anhelos. El tiempo que experiencia y las buenas referencias de su trabajo son las mejores garantías para ofrecer su servicio y ha visto a lo largo de los años que es esencial tener herramientas más sofisticadas por lo que espera que le ayuden con el préstamo que le darán para concretar sus planes.  Es su segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, en todo este tiempo de trabajo dentro de su banco comunal ha visto unidad en su grupo y siente que puede tener confianza con los demás integrantes de que seguirán siendo puntuales en su crédito que actualmente solicitan, por su parte se compromete  a seguir siendo responsable en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la renovación de nuevas herramientas que necesita para optimizar su trabajo.
texts.en: Javier is 36 years old and he lives with his wife and son, temporarily at his parents' house. He has been a construction contractor for more than 6 years, for private homes or for public works. He is hired according to what the client requires. His passion for his work moves him to try to finish in less time to please the client. He has his own work tools which permit him to provide quality service and this is why he is known in his community as a master contractor. Over the last months he has had many contracts and this has increased his earnings. He is able to support his family and to continue working on building their own house. It is one of his greatest goals. The length of his experience and good work references are the best guarantees for his business and he has seen throughout the years ant it is essential to have more sophisticated tools. He plans on settling his plans with the help of the loan. It is his second loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and during all this time he has seen the unity in his group and he feels that he can trust the other members to be on time with their loan. For his part he is committed to keep being responsible with his payments. With the loan that he requests he will invest in the purchase of new tools that he needs to optimize his work.

loans.use: to purchase new tools to improve the quality of his work.

loans.name: Kargbo United Group

texts.en:
Memuna C. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Memuna was born in Magburaka town, about 30 years ago. She is married to a driver and the couple has 2 children who are attending primary and secondary schools respectively.

For 15 years now, Memuna has been selling rice, magi, salt, biscuits, batteries, and a lot more. Members of the Kargbo group have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan of SLL 1,000,000 in order to further boost their businesses. With her share of the loan, Memuna C. is going to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: to buy rice, magi, salt, biscuits, batteries, and many more items, in bulk, to add to her current inventory.

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es: Adilia tiene 52 años, su actividad es venta de granos básicos y mercadería variada. Ella inicio este negocio con una pequeña pulpería, pero no le brindo muchos resultados, ya que tenía que atender su pulpería y además tenía que realizar las compras en el mercado. Pero con el paso del tiempo decide establecer otro negocio con la venta de granos básicos y mercadería como ropa, cosméticos, cremas entre otros ella siempre ha depositado mucho empeño en cada trabajo que realiza. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de  maíz, aceite, arroz, frijoles, concentrado y otros granos básicos que le solicitan.
texts.en: Adilia is 52 years old and she sells basic grains and a variety of merchandise. She started her business as a small grocery store but it wasn't very successful.  She needed to attend the grocery store and to make the purchases at the market. With the passage of time she established another business, selling basic grains and merchandise, including clothing, cosmetics, skin lotions and other products. She has always invested a great deal of commitment in any work she does. This loan will be used to purchase corn, cooking oil, rice, beans, bullion powder, and other basic grains that are in demand.

loans.use: to purchase corn, cooking oil, rice, beans, and other basic grains that are in demand.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
la sra. Doris P. Guierrez tiene 60 años de edad, vive en el Triunfo Choluteca y se dedica a la produccion y venta de quesillo y cuajada, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion.
doña Doris es viuda, hace mucho tiempo que se le murio el esposo y le a tocado trabajar sola para educar a sus hijos los cuales ya son profesionales. 
Doris cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de leche pura de vacas para hacer la cuajada y el quesillo.
sus tiempos libres lo dedica a visitar la iglesia
texts.en: Doris P. Guierrez is 60 years old and she lives in Triunfo Choluteca and she makes and sells cheese and curds. Her business is located in her house. Doris is a widow. Her husband passed away a long time ago, so she needed to work alone to send her children to school. They all have careers now. Doris has children's support. The loan will be used to purchase pure cow's milk to make curds and cheese. During her spare time she visits the church.

loans.use: to purchase cow milk to produce cheese and curds.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl tiene 52 años, vive con su esposa y uno de sus 3 hijos  en su casa propia. Hace más de 30 años y medio elabora faldas típicas de su región que se llaman “faldas plisadas” y “falda de milrayas” y son hechas en su propio taller que se encuentra en su casa. Que junto a su esposa y uno de sus familiares, juntos trabajan en dicho taller, pues requiere de muchas manos para agilizar el trabajo y cumplir la demanda de varios pedidos que tiene, por lo que a veces requiere contratar dos personas más para cumplir con tal propósito. Disfruta mucho la actividad que realiza, ya que desde niña aprendió a valorar el apoyo de la familia, permitiéndole además de disfrutar agradables momentos con ellos. Por los años de experiencia  en este trabajo ya tiene clientes fijos que siempre solicitan estas faldas, además de ganar nuevos clientes, por ello espera comprar una maquina de coser. Es su crédito número 3 que tiene con MFP, y le agrada saber que es parte de un grupo de personas a las que considera como parte de su familia y puede aprender mucho de ellas por lo que ha decidió seguir trabando en estos próximos meses con su crédito grupal. En esta ocasión el crédito le servirá en la compra de telas y en el mantenimiento de su maquina de coser.
texts.en: Raul is 52 years old and he lives with his wife and one of their 3 children in a house they own. For more than 30 and a half years he has been making skirts that are traditional to their region, named "pleated skirts" and "striped skirts". They are made in his shop, located in his house. He and his wife work together with a family member in the shop. He needs many helpers to speed up the work and to meet the demand and the various orders that have been placed. Sometimes he wants to hire two more people to help him with his project. He enjoys his business. As a boy he learned to value family support and it has given him the opportunity to enjoy happy moments with them. For the years of experience in the business he has fixed clients who always request these skirts and he also earns new clients. He hopes to purchase a new sewing machine. This is his third loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he is happy to know that he is part of a group of people who consider him to be part of their family. He can learn much from them which is why he has decided to keep working these next months with his communal bank. This loan will help him to purchase fabrics and to do maintenance repairs on his sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and to have his sewing machien repaired.

loans.name: Adriana María

texts.es:
Durante 19 años Adriana trabajó en un negocio de distribución de alimentos donde se desempeñaba como operaria, sin embargo, sus dueños tuvieron que liquidar el negocio dándole la oportunidad a sus empleados de quedarse en frente de los locales donde anteriormente funcionaba dicho negocio. Desde entonces, Adriana vio la oportunidad de emprender su propio negocio,  el cual se encuentra ubicado en Itagüí, municipio del Área Metropolitana de Medellín.  
 
Adriana es una microempresaria que trabaja diariamente de 8:00 a.m  a 7:00 p.m. con la ilusión de hacer crecer poco a poco su negocio y se siente afortunada por se independiente, ya que así no solo genera ingresos para el sustento de su familia, si no que dejará un legado para que en un futuro éste sea un negocio familiar, Adriana es madre de 2 hijos y sueña con darles una mejor calidad de vida.
 
Actualmente, con la esperanza de ver crecer su punto de venta de Pollo, Adriana debe surtir cierta cantidad de productos que le generen mejores utilidades, y que de alguna manera le den posicionamiento al local, sin embargo ella no cuenta con el capital para hacer esta inversión por lo que necesita de un préstamo.
texts.en:
Adriana was employed for 19 years in a food distribution firm.  However, the owners had to liquidate the business giving their employees the opportunity to continue operating the locales where the business used to be.  Since then, Adriana was able to start her own business which is located in Itagüí, a town in the Medellín Metropolitan Area.

Adriana is a micro businesswoman who works daily from 8am until 7pm with the hope of gradually increasing business.  She feels fortunate to be independent because she not only generates income for her family’s sustenance but she is forming a legacy so that in the future this could become a family business.  Adriana is the mother of two children and she dreams with providing them with a better quality of life.

Currently, with the hope of seeing her chicken sales grow, Adriana must stock a certain amount of products that generate higher profits and which will help her store stand out.  However, she does not have the necessary capital to make this investment so needs a loan.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar de 32 años, vive en el barrio Carrizal de la ciudad de Barranquilla con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 3 a 9 años; aunque  Edgar nació en Santander llegó al departamento del Atlántico con ganas de trabajar, pues su familia es muy trabajadora y  siempre su madre ha tenido tienda; así es que él tambien continuó con ese legado y una vez se instaló en la ciudad  emprendió también su tienda, donde hasta la presente,  vende ranchos, víveres y abarrotes.  Él empezó  este negocio con su hermano y con muchas ganas de cumplir su sueño, ahorrando poco a poco armó el suyo propio con resultados positivos. En la actualidad inicia su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea con su credikiva comprará víveres y abarrotes y con ello aumentar sus ventas, porque su sueño mas adelante  es tener su propia casa   y ya empezó a trabajar en esa meta;  su mayor desafío fue acceder a  financiamientos porque no tenía vida crediticia, por las pocas oportunidades que tiene una persona cuando no conocen su historial financiero y ahora ya ha iniciado ese camino. Mientras construye su sueño, continua con una rentabilidad sobre las ventas de 11% y Edgar sueña con incrementarla, para poder brindarle a su familia un futuro prometedor.
texts.en: Edgar is 32 years old and he lives in the district of Carrizal in the city of Barranquilla. He lives with his partner and their two children, aged 3 and 9. Although Edgar was born in Santander he moved to the department of Altantico for work. His family is very hard working and his mother always had a store. And so he too continued in this legacy and once he settled in the city, he also started his store, one he still has today. He sells food products and grocery merchandise. He started this business with his brother, eager to accomplish his dream. With his savings he gradually established his own with positive results. This is his first loan with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) and he plans on spending his Kiva loan on food products and groceries in order to increase his sales. His dream for the future is to have his own house and he has already started to work towards his goal. His greatest challenge was accessing a loan because he did not have a credit history. There are very few opportunities when the credit history is not known and now he has started down this path. While he builds his dream, he will continue on with a profit margin of 11%. Edgar dreams of increasing it to provide his family with a more promising future.

loans.use: to purchase food products and groceries to supply his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy Pèrez de 62 años es la propietaria de un taller de confecciones  que tiene ubicado en su casa de Villa Paraíso, un barrio de la ciudad de Barranquilla donde nacieron sus 3 hijos, hoy en   las edades de 33 a 38 años. Nancy desde muy niña se inclinó por el arte de confeccionar y por eso lo aprendió y desde hace 40 años emprendió su negocio  el cual está ubicado en este mismo lugar. Ella inició con una maquina familiar y en la actualidad su estructura de negocio la integran 4 máquinas industriales más, en su taller participa su nuera quien la apoyo y en épocas de ventas altas contrata operarias, para  poder responder a su clientela. En su negocio confecciona vestidos para damas y también ofrece el servicio de costura sobre medidas, a  quienes le traen la materia prima e insumos para que ella trabaje las modas que cada cliente solicita. Con el producto de su negocio ha logrado hacer adecuaciones a su vivienda, que en un principio era de madera. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con él comprará telas, hilos, encajes y accesorios para fabricar vestidos para damas que tiene encargados. Su meta más adelante es hacer una mejor distribución de su infraestructura,  para que su taller esté ubicado en un local separado. Mientras esto ocurre Nancy continua trabajando y generando una utilidad no menor del 45% .
texts.en:
Nancy Perez, 62, is the owner of a clothes making workshop located in her home at Villa Paraiso, a suburb of Barranquilla where her three children, aged 33 to 38 years old, were born. From an early age Nancy enjoyed sewing and that's why she trained in it. She started her business 40 years ago in this same spot. She started with a sewing machine owned by her family. Today her business structure includes an additional 4 industrial sewing machines. Her daughter-in-law helps her and during busy times she contracts workers to meet the demand from her clients. In her business she makes women's dresses and also offers made-to-measure services. Clients bring her the materials needed so she can make the fashionable items each of them demands. 
 
The returns of her business have allowed her to make improvements to her home, which used to be built in wood. This Kiva loan is her first one with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy fabric, thread, lace and accessories to fulfil orders for women's dresses that she has already received. Her goal is to improve the distribution of her infrastructure even further, so that the workshop is located in separate premises. In the meantime, Nancy continues to work and to generate a profit no less than 45%.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, lace and accessories.

loans.name: Nelcy Rossmeri

texts.es:
Nelcy es una joven de 25 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres en el distrito de Oyotun  en Chiclayo.

Nelcy se dedica  a la crianza de aves de corral (gallinas, patos y pavos) el apoyo de sus padres le permitió a Nelcy ser experta en este negocio. Ella ahora cuenta con una clientela establecida, que son los pobladores de su zona.

Nelcy solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de pavos y en el alimento balanceado que la crianza de estos requiere. Nelcy tiene muchos deseos de expandir su  negocio para poder independizarse de su familia.

Nelcy goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Nelcy is a young woman, who is 25 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in the district of Oyotun in Chiclayo.

Nelcy raises poultry (chickens, ducks and turkeys) and has become an expert in this business with the support of her parents. The inhabitants of her zone have become her loyal clientele. 

Nelcy is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternative of 1000 nuevos soles that she will use to buy turkeys and the balanced food required to raise them. Nelcy would really like to expand her business in order to become more independent from her family.

Nelcy has very good personal and professional references.

loans.use: buy ducks and balanced food.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
Esmeralda  es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa en sus labores, ella tiene 36 años de edad y vive en casa de sus padres en el distrito pesquero de Santa Rosa- Chiclayo. Santa Rosa es una comunidad de pescadores y artesanos principalmente.

Esmeralda se dedica a la elaboración de bordados en cinta, hace 3  años  se dedica a esto.  Su madre fue quien le enseñó a bordar. Esmeralda cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona.  Además, Esmeralda obtiene otros ingresos  por realizar análisis de laboratorio.

Esmeralda solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de material para sus bordados como son las cintas, hilos y agujas  debido a que ya tiene pedidos para estos. Además ella necesita surtir  su negocio y para poder tener mayores ingresos y  así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is a hard-working woman, dedicated to her tasks.  She is 36 years old, and lives with her parents in the fishing district of Santa Rosa – Chiclayo.  Santa Rosa is a community consisting mostly of fishermen and artisans.  

Esmeralda does ribbon embroidery, and has been doing this for 3 years.  Her mother taught her to embroider.  She has a customer base in the area.  Esmeralda derives other income from doing lab analyses.

Esmeralda is requesting a loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which she will use to purchase supplies for her embroidery, such as ribbon, thread, and needles.  She has orders pending for her work.  She also needs to stock her business, to increase her earnings and thus improve her standard of living.

loans.use: buy ribbon, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Aracelis

texts.es:
Aracelis Rico con su credikiva pasado adquirió 5 lavadoras,  que le facilitaron nuevos ingresos en su negocio de servicio de arrendamiento por horas, dirigido a que  las amas de casa cumplan con su tarea de lavar la ropa de la familia, de una manera más fácil .Aracelis está aplicando a su nuevo credikiva y con él comprará mercancías variadas, porque también maneja ingresos por este concepto y aprovechando que tiene pedidos de ropa femenina, calzado y perfumes, invertirá en estas solicitudes que le han hecho las amas de casa y sus familias que son sus principales clientes. El mensaje que Aracelis envía a sus financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Me siento  muy feliz y agradecida con el apoyo recibido,  por brindarme la oportunidad de mejorar mis ingresos y los de mi familia, un beso y un abrazo a mis financiadores.
Si usted quiere conocer la Historia de Aracelis ingrese al siguiente enlace:http://www.kiva.org/lend/194703
texts.en:
With her last Kiva loan, Aracelis Rico bought 5 washing machines. This provided new revenue for her leasing-by-the-hour business service, aimed at making the housewives' task of washing their family's clothes much easier. Aracelis will use her new Kiva loan to buy different goods. She also generates revenue selling them and, as she already has orders for women's clothes, shoes and perfumes, she will invest in these requests coming from housewives and their families, who are her main customers. 

The message that Aracelis would like to send to those financing her through Kiva is the following: "I am very happy and grateful for  the support, for giving me  the opportunity to  improve  my income  and that of my family. A kiss and a hug to all my sponsors". To know Araceli's full story click on the following link: http://www.kiva.org/lend/194703

loans.use: to buy women's clothes, shoes and perfumes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes, rubber bowls and medicines in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es:
Asunción es un señor de 59 años de edad, él vive junto a su esposa en la zona rural del distrito de La Victoria en Chiclayo. Asunción es conocido en la zona por ser un hombre honrado y trabajador y tener una sólida unión familiar.

Asunción tiene una gran experiencia realizando labores agrícolas. Él cultiva en sus propias tierras que están ubicadas a 20 minutos de distancia de su hogar. Asunción tiene 20 años de experiencia en este rubro.

Asunción solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de  1000 nuevos soles que  utilizará para abonar su cultivo de arroz y así poder tener una producción optima que le permita generar ingresos para su hogar.

Asunción  estaría muy agradecido de concedérsele el crédito pues el desea darle una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa.
texts.en:
Asunción is a 59-year-old gentleman who lives with his wife in the rural section of the District of La Victoria in Chiclayo. He is known in the area for being an honest man, working hard, and having strong family ties.

Asunción has plenty of experience as a farmer. He cultivates his own land which is located 20 minutes away from his home. Asunción has 20 years of experience in this trade.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN. The funds will be used to fertilize his rice field so that it will result in optimal production. This will allow him to generate household income. Asunción is very grateful for the loan that was granted because he wants to provide his wife with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase compost to fertilize his rice field.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
En el departamento del Cusco, capital Cusco conocido desde hace muchos años como la "Capital Arqueológica de América", se reúnen cada treinta días las socias del Banco Comunal “Todos Unidos” en la oficinas central de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú.

En este banco comunal conocimos al señor Antonio y nos cuenta que nació en la ciudad de Puno, tiene 55 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tiene tres hijos. 

Antonio desde el año 2000 que se dedica a vender adornos y auto partes para automóviles, él tiene un puesto de venta en el centro comercial “Auto Partes San Pedro” pero el local está alquilado. En esta oportunidad Antonio requiere el préstamo para comprar mercedaria como por ejemplo adornos, radios, bocinas, llantas, gatas y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
