He lives in a rural part of this district and has only electricity at his home.

Roberto raises cattle and sheep; he has 30 sheep and two cows at the moment.  He is also a farmer.  He has 1.0 hectares of agricultural land, on which he cultivates corn and mangoes.

Roberto is seeking a loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy fertilizer and agrochemicals for his corn crop, as well as to purchase balanced feed for his animals.

Roberto is a well-known client of Edpyme Alternativa, and has always been responsible and punctual in his payments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and agrochemicals for corn cultivation.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer tiene 28 años de edad, vive en casa de su madre  que está ubicada en el caserío pedregal Alto del Distrito de Tambogrande caserío mediano con deseos de superación.

Wilmer se dedica a la agricultura,  contando con 0.5 hectáreas de terreno agrícola donde cultiva limón,  el cual cosecha semanalmente y asiste diariamente. Además también se desempeña en el rubro de la ganadería, criando y comercializando animales menores los cuales al alcanzar peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en el mercado de su localidad, Wilmer tiene 3 años trabajando en este rubro , años en los cuales a podido conseguir clientela fija.

Wilmer esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de limón y compra de alimentos para el engorde de los ovinos para así lograr una mejor producción y tener una  mejor calidad de vida. 

Wilmer es un cliente nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa, y se tiene muy buenas referencias de sus persona.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 28 years old.  He lives in his mother's house, which is located in a farmstead in Pedregal Alto in the district of Tambogrande; it's a medium-size farmstead that he hopes to enlarge. 

Wilmer is a farmer.  He has .5 hectares of agricultural land.  He grows lemons, which he harvests weekly and attends to on a daily basis.  In addition, he raises livestock, rearing and selling small animals.  He sells them in the local market when they reach their ideal size. Wilmer has been in this trade for three years and has built up a loyal clientele.
 
Wilmer is seeking a loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy fertilizer for growing lemons and to buy feed for his sheep so that he can improve production and have a better quality of life.

Wilmer is a new client with Edpyme Alternativa, but he comes with very good references.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow lemons and feed for his sheep.

loans.name: Nery

texts.es:
Nery tiene 30 años de edad. Ella es joven y vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos en su casa propia. Ellos residen en la ciudad de Urubamba que pertenece al departamento de Cusco al sur del Perú. Su casa está ubicada cerca de la plaza de armas del distrito.

Nery se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir en el Centro Comercial de Señor de Torrechayoc en la ciudad de Urubamba. Para poder desarrollar su actividad, Nery ha alquilado un puesto de venta en el centro comercial. 

Nery tiene muchos clientes y cuenta con la fidelidad de muchos de ellos, su negocio es muy conocido a solo cuatro años de su creación. Ella cuenta con una muy buena ubicación estratégica para la venta ya que se encuentra ubicada en el centro de la cuidad.

Nery es cliente conocida de la Asociación Arariwa ya que recibió varios créditos y los pagó con responsabilidad. Ahora ella está solicitando un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 para que de esta manera Nery pueda comprar y surtir con mas mercadería, implementar e innovar su negocio con novedades en prendas de vestir y obsequios según la estación.

Nery tiene un espíritu emprendedor, ella quiere que sus inventarios y su negocio crezcan. Pues ella desea ser una empresaria de éxito pues cuenta con muchas cualidades de las que resaltan su puntualidad y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Nery is 30 years old.  She is a young woman who lives with her partner and two children in her own home.  They live in the city of Urubamba, in Cusco department, in the south of Peru.  Her home is located near the district's main square.

Nery sells clothes in the Señor de Torrechayoc shopping mall in the city of Urubamba.  In order to carry out her business, Nery has rented a sales location in the shopping mall.

Nery has many customers and many of them are loyal to her business.  Her business is very well known even though it has only been around for four years.  She has a very good, strategic sales location since she her business is located in the city center.

Nery is a well-known client of Asociación Arariwa since she has already received several loans and repaid them responsibly.  She is now requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles to buy more merchandise for her business.  She will stock and innovate her business with new clothes and gifts according to the season.

Nery has an entrepreneurial spirit.  She would like her stock and business to grow.  She would like to become a successful businesswoman.  She has many good qualities.  In particular, she is punctual and responsible.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Luisa Vicentina

texts.es:
La ciudad de Urubamba es conocido por sus paisajes hermosas, que son muy visitadas por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros, ofrece diversidad de lugares hermosos y una rica variedad de platos típicos de la región.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Luisa Vicentina que nació en la ciudad de Pisaq (Cusco, Perú), tiene 50 años de edad, tiene su pareja y fruto de esta relación tienen dos hijos. Ella trabaja en un centro nutricional para niños especiales en la  ciudad de Urubamba desde las 8h30 de la mañana hasta las 15h30 de lunes a viernes.   

Ella también tiene una pequeña funeraria en un local alquilado en la cual trabaja junto a su esposo, allí brindar servicios de funeraria y también venden ataúdes, entre otras cosas, el esposo es quien fabrica los ataúdes. Nos cuenta que tiene 5 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

Este crédito lo va a emplear para abastecer más el local, va a comprar madera y otros productos que se necesitan para fabricar más productos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace varios años y le gusta por la confraternidad que hay en el grupo.

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y  construir su casa.
texts.en:
The city of Urubamba is known for its beautiful scenic spots which are visited by many local and foreign tourists.  It offers a variety of beautiful places and a rich variety of dishes that are typical of the region.

We met Luisa Vicentina here.  She was born in the city of Pisaq (Cusco, Perú) is 50 years old and has a spouse.  They have two children.  She works in a nutrition center for children with special needs in the city of Urubamba from 8:30am until 3:30pm, Monday through Friday.

She also has a small funeral parlor in a rented locale where she works with her husband providing funeral services.  They also sell coffins, among other things.  Her husband manufactures the coffins.  She tells us that she’s been in this business for five years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into the work. She will use this loan to better stock her business.  She will buy lumber and other products that are needed to make more products.  

She’s been in the communal bank for several years and likes it because of the confraternity that exists in the group.  Her goals are to stay in business and build her house.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia es una madre de familia de 40 años de edad, vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposo en una casa propia de material rústico en una comunidad llamada Chichubamba, la cual pertenece al distrito de Urubamba y se encuentra a una distancia de poco más de una hora de la distrito de Cusco. Urubamba es un lugar que llama mucho la atención por su atractivo turístico y por ser una zona dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería.

Desde unos 3 años aproximadamente Eusebia se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos, etc.), su negocio lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad y seguridad. Con las ganancias por la venta de sus productos trata de cubrir todos sus gastos y mejorar su nivel de vida.

Para poder comprar mas mercadería a solicitado un crédito a Asociación Arariwa de 1000 nuevos soles, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca; mejorando sus ingresos podrá cubrir todas sus necesidades, cumpliendo también con los pagos mensuales de su crédito.

Eusebia es una madre responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por que sus hijos sean cada vez mejor y ayudarlos a que cumplan sus sueños más adelante y en un futuro tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Eusebia, 40, is a mother living with her three children and her husband in a house of her own made from flimsy materials in a community called Chichubamba which belongs to Urubamba District and is located a little over an hour away from Cusco District.  Urubamba is a place that draws attention because of its tourist sites and because it’s a zone dedicated to farming and raising livestock.

For about three years Eusebia has been selling groceries (items that are used daily: milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs, etc.).  Her business is located in her home for her comfort and security.  She uses profits from her sales to try to cover all her expenses and improve her standard of living.

She has asked Asociación Arariwa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy more merchandise.  Her only ideal is that her business grows improving her income to cover all her needs and also being able to make her monthly loan payments.

Eusebia is a responsible, dedicated and hard working mother who is concerned to see that her children become better each time helping them to reach their future dreams and later on have a larger business.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Segundo Andres

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su menor hijo. Ellos residen en una localidad bastante grande del  distrito de Chepen en el departamento de La Libertad a una hora de Chiclayo.

Segundo se dedica a la comercialización de juguetes, en una zona comercial cerca a su hogar.  Dicha actividad la realiza de manera ambulatoria desde hace más de 6 años, en los cuales a obtenido experiencia en el rubro. Con estas actividad segundo realiza el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Segundo está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para poder invertir en su negocio, comprando más mercadería y de esta manera obtener mayores oportunidades de venta.

Segundo es una persona entusiasta y empeñosa, con muy buenas referencias, además cuenta con el apoyo su familia, para desarrollar su negocio y poder salir a delante.
texts.en:
Segundo, 48, lives with his wife and youngest son.  They live in a rather large town in the district of Chepen in the department of La Lilbertad, an hour from Chiclayo.

He sells toys at the shopping center near his home.  He has been working as a street vendor for over six years and gained much experience.  With this business he is able to support his family.

Segundo is very enthusiastic and hard-working, with good references.  He also has the support of his family to develop his business and get ahead.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth nació en la ciudad de Cusco y es madre de dos niños, ella tiene 43 años de edad y vive junto a su pareja en una casa ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco, Perú.  Este lugar se caracteriza por ser un sector turístico, ganadero, agrícola y por estar habitado de gente emprendedora que se identifica con el refrán de la localidad que dice: “Provincia Arqueológica del Perú"”.

Con más de 10 años de experiencia como artesana y actualmente trabaja en el pequeño taller en su domicilio, ella implemento y acomodo un lugar de su casa para trabajar con tranquilidad y seguridad, ella también vende en el Mercado Modelo de Artesanos de la ciudad de Urubamba. Ya son tres años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Elizabeth solicita un préstamo a la Asociación Arariwa de 400 nuevos soles que utilizará para comprar materiales como por ejemplo cola, pintura, esmaltes y otras cosas más para poder tener un mayor capital. Esto le permitirá expandir su negocio obteniendo mayores ganancias para el bienestar de sus hijos.

Elizabeth cuenta con buena reputación en Asociación Arariwa, pues con anterioridad éste ha tenido varios créditos cancelados con puntualidad y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Elizabeth was born in the city of Cusco.  She is 43 years old, has two children, and lives with her partner in a house which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department, Peru.  This area is known for its tourism, livestock raising, farming and the fact that it is inhabited by entrepreneurial people who feel part of the "Arqueological Province of Peru".

Elizabeth has more than ten years' experience as a craftswoman and currently works in a small workshop which is located in her home.  She set up and adapted a place in her home so that she could work safely and peacefully.  She also sells her products in the Mercado Modelo craft market in the city of Urubamba.  She has been in this business for three years and it is doing very well thanks to the commitment that she puts into her work.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan for 400 Peruvian soles from Asociación Arariwa to buy materials such as glue, paint, varnishes and other products so that she has more capital.  This will allow her to expand her business and make more profits to contribute towards her children's well-being.

Elizabeth has a good reputation with Asociación Arariwa because she has already had several loans which she repaid on time and responsibly.

loans.use: to buy materials such as glue, paint and varnishes

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: La señora Paulina tiene 37 años y se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, pollos y chanchos. El crédito lo requiere para la comprar de cuyes, gallinas y chanchos para continuar con su negocio de venta de animales menores de donde genera sus ingresos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la población de Chichubamba en el distrito de Urubamba provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco, Perú. Esta es la primera vez que canalizamos su crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Paulina, 27, raises small farm animals like guinea pigs, chickens and pigs for example.  She needs the loan to buy guinea pigs, chickens and pigs to continue in her business selling small farm animals which is her source of income.

She lives in a house of her own located in the town of Chichubamba in Urubamba Province, Cusco Department, Perú.  This is the first time that we have channeled her loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Nueva Ilusión (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nueva Ilusión esta formado por 11 mujeres quienes viven en la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus ancestros, son personas muy trabajadoras se dedican a diferentes actividades como al comercio, cría de animales o a la agricultura. Nuestras socias nos demuestran que son personas luchadoras ya que con su sacrificio aportan a la economía de sus hogares para salir adelante.

La Señora Mónica T. vive en la comunidad de 3 de Noviembre en la parroquia de Cumbe, tiene 19 años, es casada y tiene un niño de 1 año de edad. Su esposo labora como albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven en la casa de sus suegros en donde comparten los gastos del hogar.
 
Doña Mónica se dedica al cuidado de su hijo y como pasa en casa cría y vende pollos y cuyes, inicio con esta actividad desde que se caso. También le gusta tejer a crochet, realiza chalinas (vestimenta tradicional), esto aprendió sola y por habilidad.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 2 ciclos y fue invitada por su suegra, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y cuyes.
 
Su meta es tener una tienda.

En esta ocasión nos acompañan en el foto dos niños que son hijos de dos socias.
texts.en: The Nueva Ilusión (New Illusion) community bank consists of 11 women who live in the parish of Cumbre, which has a cool climate and the people maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors. The members are very hard-working women who make a living in various activities such as commerce,  livestock or agriculture. They have shown themselves to be fighters willing to sacrifice to support their household finances and make headway. Mónica lives in the Third of November community in Cumbre, is 19, married and has a 1-year-old son. Her husband is a construction worker. They do not have their own home so they live in her in-laws' house and share in the household expenses. Mónica dedicates herself to caring for her son and raising and selling chickens and guinea pigs, which she has been doing since she got married. She also enjoys crocheting, making traditional garments, which she learned to do herself. She has been a member of the community bank for the past two loan cycles and was invited to join by her mother-in-law. She plans to use the money from the loan to purchase chickens and guinea pigs. Her goal is to have a store. The two children in the photo belong to two of the members.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario nació en la ciudad de Urubamba y es padre de 2 niños, él tiene 50 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa en una casa ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco, Perú.  Este lugar se caracteriza por ser un sector turístico, ganadero, agrícola y por estar habitado de gente emprendedora que se identifica con el refrán de la localidad que dice: “Provincia Arqueológica del Perú"”.

Con más de 6 años de experiencia como jefe de registro civil de la ciudad de Urubamba  y los podemos encontrar cumpliendo su deberes en la municipalidad de Urubamba desde las 8h00 hasta las 16h00 de lunes a viernes, Mario también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores.

Mario solicita un préstamo a Asociación Arariwa de 1500 nuevos soles que utilizará para comprar más animales como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, patos y cerdos para poder tener un mayor capital. Esto le permitirá expandir su negocio obteniendo mayores ganancias para el bienestar de sus 2 hijos.

Mario cuenta con buena reputación en Asociación Arariwa, pues con anterioridad éste ha tenido varios créditos cancelados con puntualidad y responsabilidad.
texts.en: Mario is a native of the city of Urubama and is a father of two children. He is 50 years old and lives with his wife in a house in Urubamba, department of Cusco, Peru. This area is known for being a tourist zone rich with livestock and agriculture, and the skillful and hard-working people identify with the local saying: "Peru's Archaeological Province." Mario has more than six years of experience as Urubamba's chief registrar and can be found fulfilling his duties from 8 a.m. until 4 p.m. Monday through Friday. He also makes a living raising small animals and is requesting a loan of 1,500 soles from Kiva partner Asociación Arariwa that he plans to use to purchase more animals, such as guinea pigs, chickens, ducks and pigs, so he can increase his capital. This will allow him to expand his business and earn more profits he can put toward the well-being of his two children. Mario has a good reputation with Asociación Arariwa since in the past he has repaid his various loans punctually and responsibly.

loans.use: to purchase animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, ducks and pigs.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Urubamba  del departamento del Cusco, Hay un lugar conocido como Chichubamba este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Maritza y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Saywa - Chichubamba”,  tiene 28 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hjos. Ella es profesora y trabaja como profesora auxiliar en el colegio particular “TIKAPATA”. Ya son dos años que trabaja enseñando y le va muy bien.   
 
Ella también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo gallinas y cuyes, tiene una pequeña granja en su casa, nos cuenta que compra cuyes los cuales los cría durante dos a tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, después de este tiempo llegan hasta su casa, comerciante,  vecinos, familiares y dueños de restaurantes de la localidad.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar para comprar cuyes y gallinas, alimentos y medicinas para sus animalitos. 
Su sueño es que crezca el negocio y tener una gran cantidad de animales menores.
texts.en: In the city of Urubamba, department of Cusco, Peru, there's a place called Chichubamba known for its beautiful scenery, gastronomy and the warmth of its people. Here we find Maritza, who belongs to the "Saywa - Chichubamba" community bank. She is 28 years old, married and has two children. She is a teacher and works as an assistant at "TIKAPATA" school. She has been teaching for two years and it is going very well. She also makes a living raising small animals such as chickens and guinea pigs. She has a small farm at her house, and she tells us she raises the guinea pigs she buys for two to three months until they are ready to be sold, after which time she offers them to merchants, neighbors, family members and local restaurant owners. She plans to use this loan to purchase guinea pigs and chickens, as well as feed and medicine for the animals. Her dream is to grow her business so she can have a larger number of small animals.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and chickens, as well as feed and medicine for the animals

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Urubamba  del departamento del Cusco, Hay un lugar conocido como Chichubamba este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Avelina y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Saywa - Chichubamba”,  tiene 35 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta relación tiene un hijo.  
 
Avelina es ama de casa y busco la manera de tener un ingreso extra para el gasto familiar y su hermana Celia le motivo para que se dedicara  a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo pollos entonces desde hace dos meses atrás, ella ha implementado en su casa una pequeña granja, nos cuenta que compra pollos los cuales los cría durante dos a tres meses que es el tiempo para que ya estén listos para la venta, después de este tiempo llegan comerciante,  vecinos, familiares y dueños de restaurantes de la localidad hasta su casa para comprar sus animales que son de buena calidad.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar para comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para sus animalitos. 
Su sueño es que crezca el negocio y tener una gran cantidad de animales menores.
texts.en: In the city of Urubamba, department of Cusco, Peru, there is a place called Chichubama that is known for its beautiful scenery, gastronomy and the warmth of its people. It is here we find Avelina, who belongs to the "Saywa - Chichubamba" community bank. She is 35 years old, married and has one son. She is a housewife and was looking for a way to earn extra income for the family finances, when two months ago her sister Celia encouraged her to start making a living raising small animals like chickens. She has set up a small coop at her house and tells us that she raises the chickens she buys for two to three months until they are ready for sale, at which time she offers them to merchants, neighbors, family members and local restaurant owners before buying more animals that are of high quality. With this loan, she plans to purchase chickens as well as feed and medicine for the animals. Her dream is to grow her business and have a larger number of animals.

loans.use: to purchase chickens as well as feed and medicine for the animals

loans.name: Jandan

texts.en:
Jandan, 29, is married and lives with her husband and only son in a house in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband works in a public organization. Her son hasn't reached school age, so he stays home. 

Jandan manages a clothing and hat business in her town. She started her business in 2000. Since then she has managed to stabilize her business and build a strong customer base. Now she sells all kinds of women's and men's wear for all ages. She plans to continue her business in the future. 

Jandan is a hardworking and open-minded lady who says, "I want to have my own apartment in the future." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more hats and clothing for her business

loans.name: Lhagvajav

texts.en:
Lhagvajav lives with his wife and three children in a house in Darhan-Uul Province, Mongolia. His younger two children go to a local secondary school, while his wife is a cook in Haan Buuz cafe, one of the well-known fast food chains in Mongolia. With the help of his older son, Lhagvajav operates an auto repair and welding service which he started in 2006 in his town. He also used to have a pig farm and a coal-trading business in order to supplement his family earnings. He intends to resume his coal operation.

A hardworking man who has been able to expand his business, today Lhagvajav is one of the most successful businessmen in his town. With his earnings he started to build a house on his plot of land and says, "With the loan received from Xacbank I had an opportunity to finish the construction work of my house. Now I want to have a car to use for my business." He is therefore requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a new car.

loans.use: to purchase a new car.

loans.name: Marifi

texts.en:
A young entrepreneur at 34, Marifi continually finds ways to improve her business. Marifi finished high school and is married to Isagani, a driver. They have two children, one who studies in elementary school and one who is not yet of school age. Their family resides in Silang, Cavite, south of Manila.

Marifi manages her own sari-sari (variety) store. Along with grocery items and beverages, she also sells liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) and maintains a poultry supply. Marifi handles these businesses on her own without the assistance of any employees and earns around PHP 10,800 a month. She also attends weekly fellowship* and undergoes entrepreneurial training in CCT* to sharpen her skills and strengthen her relationship with God.

To help her grow her business, she is borrowing PHP 29,000. This she intends to use to purchase more products to fill her store shelves. She deems this necessary because she observed that customers are attracted to buy when there are a lot of items on display. She also plans to purchase more LPGs for sale. 

Marifi is thankful for the opportunity to be given a loan because it will surely help her to meet her family's daily needs and assist her in renovating their house.

Marifi confesses that she is threatened by the competition brought by the newly opened store near them. She also says that at times her sales are low because she has to open her store only after she has brought her children to school. But she believes she can overcome these struggles with new strategies and make her dreams a reality. She dreams of opening another store and of being able to send her children all the way to college.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more quantities of grocery items and LPG.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Incapability is an obstacle to optimum performance. That is why Zenaida works hard to make sure she doesn't get behind because of the lack of ability to perform well--be it in business or in her family life. At 60, she is a persevering micro entrepreneur, a loving life partner and mother, and a dedicated community partner in CCT*. She co-heads a family with Salvador. They reside in General Mariano Alvarez (GMA), Cavite, south of Manila.

Zenaida currently runs her own sari-sari (variety) store. Aside from handpicking brands and products that suit the tastes of her customers, Zenaida also sells fresh fish for her fellow community members. She makes sure she delivers only the best food for them. Her space is located in the community market in GMA. Also, she rents out an apartment to workers who choose to live independently. Monthly she is able to earn PHP 11,900.

To help her continue operation of her business, she has applied for a loan of PHP 17,000. This she will use to purchase more stocks of products like canned goods and soft drinks, sugar and coffee and liters of cooking oil. She also intends to make fresh fish available for her customers on a regular basis. According to Zenaida, this loan will help her earn more and thus save more for the schooling of her children.

Zenaida admits that there are times when the sales are so low she doesn't seem to make any profit at all. She also confesses that it's hard to do business alone since her husband had a stroke. But Zenaida does not want any incapability to hinder her from receiving God's best for her. She aims to make up for what is lost and make her store grow even more. Aside from building her own apartment, she also hopes to have her own vehicle for delivery, which the family can also use to attend activities at church. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more fresh fish for selling and also additional grocery items for her variety store.

loans.name: 9 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en:
Mrs.  Thuc is 47 years old. She is married and has two children. Thuc is the group leader of the 7.1.9 Nam Ngan solidarity group, which consists of five members. Thuc lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Thuc operates a food stall/restaurant, selling meat. Thuc has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. This is Thuc's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Thuc hopes to maintain a successful business, to remodel her house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase pork

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia is married with two children. Both of them are very young, not of school-going age yet. 

Asia is a housewife. She stays at home and takes care of the children. She is a very good wife and a very caring mother. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession. He sells a variety of seasonal fresh fruits to his customers cheaply. Because his fruits are fresh and good quality, he makes good profits every month. 

Asia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s fruit selling business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits for selling to his customers and he will earn a good profit. Her husband has been operating this business for the past eight years and Asia is very confident that an investment will bring more profits to him and expand his business. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first application to Asasah. She is hopeful that an investment will be a profitable one for her family.

In the photo, the lady raising a hand is Asia.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra is a 51-year-old housewife, who manages her household expenses very well and fulfills her daily routine tasks with a great sense of responsibility. She is married with two sons. Both of them work. Her elder son sells vegetables while the younger one is involved with selling fruits. 
Her husband is a fruit vendor by profession and sells fresh seasonal fruits to his clients. 

Azra has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for the expansion of her husband’s fruit selling business. With this loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits to sell to his clients. He believes in providing his clients with good quality fruits which helps him to retain customers and make better profits. Her husbnad has been operating his business for the past 15 years and Azra is confident that an investment will help him further expand his business and increase his profits. 

Azra is a new loan applicant and this is her first application to Asasah. She is hopeful that it will be a profitable experience for her family. 

In the photo, the lady raising a hand is Azra.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.name: Nasira's Group

texts.en:
Nasira is 52 years, married and has a son. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession. Her son is also involved in the same profession of selling fruits. He started this business to support his father financially. He knows that alone his father can't meet the expenses of his family.  
Therefore, Nasira has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her son with the expansion of his business. With the loan, he will purchase fresh seasonal fruits to sell to his customers. He started this business about two years ago and it is going well for him. Nasira is hopeful that an investment will bring even more profits to him. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah. She hopes that it will be a good step for her son’s business. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Nasira.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 44 years old and married with three adult-aged children. She has managed a hog raising business for five years and she is grateful for the improvement of her business. Gina would like to maintain her hog raising business but she doesn't have enough capital to run this business. Therefore, she would like to borrow a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed for her hogs. According to her, this loan would really help her, especially now, because of the high cost of feed and other commodities needed in her daily activities. 

Gina is praying that she receives the loan to be able to provide the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs
